description:
Tasty friendly fast. The owner stayed open for us at 3:05pm even though they close for the afternoon. Bonus points for honoring the lunch special. 

Brownie points for meaty duck pieces in the duck fried rice.
author: Helen C.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. Good food. Family owned. Great lunch specials. Thoughtful presentation and very tasty!
author: Claudia B.

description:
2.5 STARS

The roommate and I had just made it back from the Caribbean and I was starving! I was particularly missing Asian food after not having it for a week. We decided to order lunch from Patpong Thai Cuisine on Saturday, September 9th at 12:58pm through Delivery dot com. It arrived at 1:48pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

23. Hot & Sour with Shrimp (Tom Yum): Hot and spicy, With kaffir lime leaves, galangal root, mushrooms, roasted chili paste ($12.95)
28. Spicy Basil Fried Rice: Hot and spicy, Chicken with crushed chili peppers, onions, tomatoes, bell pepper and Thai basil ($10.50)
30. Pad Thai: Thin rice noodles stir-fried with Chicken, fried tofu, egg, bean sprouts and green onions with crushed peanuts on the side ($10.50)
37. Green Curry (Gang Keo Warn) with Chicken: Hot and spicy, With Chinese eggplant, bell pepper, zucchini, green bean and basil ($11.50)
*Chef's Special Papaya Salad: Prawns, tomatoes, carrots, green beans in chili-lime sauce, no cashew nuts ($11.95)
*Brown Rice ($2)

We have our usual Thai spot we order from, but they weren't delivering for lunch, so I just picked this restaurant. Overall, I thought the flavors were too one note. And everything was overly sweet. I wanted more spiciness and fishiness to balance out the papaya salad. The curry had a good amount of heat, but I found it thin. I tend to like a thicker curry. The soup also needed more lemongrass (or something) for contrast. The roommate ordered the other two things and seemed to enjoy them.

Kinda wished our usual spot was delivering as I wasn't impressed. Everything just needed more flavor. Especially spice as I noted most things extra spicy. Oh well, at least I tried a new spot!
author: Elena N.

description: Was able to deliver to the VA Hospital in less then 30 mins. The spicy basil beef was hot and fresh, a welcome relief from hospital food. I will definitely order again.
author: Eric V.

description: It has been years since I last ate at Patpong Samila. I had to stop by the medical supply place next door and was pretty hungry afterwards.  I ordered the lunch special Duck Fried Rice with crab added.  I also got the fried egg rolls.  I enjoyed the egg rolls more than the rice.  The fried rice was dry and bland tasting.  The duck meat was dry and a bit hard, maybe it was old?  The lady server was nice but when she brought my bill she asked me to pay in cash.  I asked her why, and she said that they don't have much cash money.  I was irritated especially since I wanted to use my credit card.  I guess I know why I won't come back.
author: Emy B.

description: Just a great place for lunch. I always get the eggplant rice special with fried tofu side and brown rice option. The portions are huge and the food is delicious.
author: Ho N.

description: Good enough when hungry. I've had better Thai food. I had roast duck fried rice only which was okay. The service was good and the lunch combination looked reasonable price.
author: Kay D.

description: I ordered Guay Tiew Rod noodle online with extra prawns,and turned out there were only two prawns in it. It is said on the menu that extra prawns will come with 4 pieces of prawns. Not to mention the noodle itself will have prwans as well. Why there only two pieces of prawns? Super bad service. The quality is not good either.
author: Steven Z.

description: All the dishes were very bland and we ordered medium to hot spice level. Watery soup. The appetizer had zero meat and it was supposed to be a dumpling filled with meat. Literally no meat. Poor quality and flavor. Good price points but I guess you get what you pay for. (This was for delivery).
author: Brooke S.

description: Patpong is really tasty with excellent prices. Its a neighborhood restaurant that has lasted all the changes.  I would recommend you try them for lunch or dinner and they deliver.
author: Susie S.

description:
We were craving Thai takeout and had no idea where to turn after our favorite neighborhood Thai place closed.
We chose Patpong! The food arrived fairly quick, maybe 40 minutes or so, and the driver was friendly. 
I ordered the Chicken Satay - tasty, great peanut sauce, good cucumber salad!
And the pineapple fried rice, and it was boring. The best part was the cashews and raisins in the rice. There wasn't enough seasoning, and we had to add quite a bit of soy sauce to get it to taste like anything. It was underwhelming and I'm not sure if we will be ordering again.
The best part of the meal was the Thai Iced Tea...those were delicious!
author: Larissa S.

description:
Disappointing. Been here three times already and each time the flavors were inconsistent. I got the Tom Yum soup and it just tasted like hot water with chilies. Their basil chicken was bland with no flavor what so ever.  

Not a place I'd recommend.
author: Me V.

description: Pad Thai with crab was not fresh. I called to ask if it was fresh, real crab. They assured me it was, when we picked up the food and brought it home, the crab meat smelled strong and had a white grey appearance and was slightly mushy - all signs that it's not fresh. I even tried a bite and couldn't swallow it. The pad Thai without the crab was too sweet and had a bad aftertaste. My friend's pad kee Mao didn't have basil in it. I avoided this place for years because of the name, and I'm glad I didn't bother eating there judging from the food we tried. I hope they improve their food or maybe don't have crab on the menu unless it's fresh then make it a special for the day.
author: Heather U.

description: This is my wife and my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco! When we lived in the city we ordered it about once a week. The Pra Ram and the Ka Pao are our favorite dishes! The curries are also very tasty. And of course you have to get the garlic rice. The food is very flavorful, the meat is fresh/high quality, there is a great selection, and they have great prices. The staff is also very friendly. One time, we brought family from out of town and the staff showed us how they fold origami flowers from the straw wrappers and place it on top of the straw.
author: Joshua F.

description:
This place has a kind staff, but the food is disappointing. 

I tried this place a couple of times and I can never say I was fully satisfied. The beer filled but it didn't get me tipsy and I feel that way about he food too. The curry is weak, the fried rice lack luster, and the pad Thai was dry.
author: Rodrigo C.

description: This place is horrible. We were looking for a quick bite and went in for some pad thai- everything else in the area was closed. It was covered in ultra sweet syrup. The noodles were gummy. No part of the dish even resembled pad Thai. Could not eat more than a few bites.
author: Ema H.

description: Great staff, very attentive and the papaya salad and tofu pad Thai were 10/10. Highly recommend.
author: Matt M.

description:
Not bad for a pickup the food was hot and fresh 
Very bland cooked food, nothing special to write home about. Good food if your hungry and in a hurry
author: Irving S.

description:
"Meow!!!!!"
This cheetah shouts as he and his friend realize that every restaurant in the area seems to be packed and has a long wait for seating. With the both of us feeling quite hungry for dinner, we had almost given up hope, until we happened across patpong and saw no wait and many open tables. Destiny? Or maybe a case of the place not being that great? We would take the chance and find out! 

Patpong is one of those restaurants I always pass by, but never actually got the chance to give it a try. 
It is a block or so away from the "restaurant row" of Clement, so perhaps that's why. 

The menu here has your standard options you expect to see in a Thai restaurant. To which of course I had to get pad Thai with chicken as this is my go to. And what cat can resist a Thai iced tea? *note* they even had a yelp check in offer for a free one too! 

The meal came out very quickly and was presented beautifully. The entire restaurant on that note was actually quite pretty. Very elegant and pretty decor that made me feel like I was somewhere else. 

Delicious! The pad Thai with chicken was perfectly done, and just enough flavor an slice to make me purr. All the while, extremely friendly service and a waiter who was very attentive to our needs. 

Price wise, pretty standard for a Thai restaurant. Not necessarily for diners on a budget, but you won't break the bank. 

Two paws up from this spotty cat! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description: I got a ton of noodles that were very dry, they were coated in minimal sauce and very little meat... It was also flavorless, which forced me to add a ton of chilli paste...
author: Eric W.

description: Lifesavers. I order delivery from this place regularly and they're always fast and great. The veggie pad Thai is superb and the Thai tea is excellent. Can't say enough good things about this place.
author: Bianca H.

description: Why is this place not 5-stars? It's ambience is perfect, food tasty, service friendly, prices reasonable, and parking is fairly easy.
author: Sergey A.

description: This is an authentic Thai experience. We were pleasantly surprised by the delicious lunch specials we both ordered. Service was friendly, timely and the place is clean. We will return.
author: Tambi L.

description: Patpong is a good little spot if you're craving good inexpensive Thai food. Everything I've gotten is pretty good but not the best Thai food I've ever had. They have good service and their take out is pretty quick.
author: Jenn A.

description: Google menu incorrect. Says soup is 4.5 per person so I ordered 2 but was charged 10+ for 2 large soups. Unwilling to negotiate or take off extra item. Just paid $40 for 1 entree and some soup. Food was just ok, disappointing since they're close to home.
author: Michelle L.

description:
came here bc my friend recommended it 

i only ordered pad kee mao. it didnt taste like thai food, it was more like chinese food with a lot less flavor. it wasnt very spicy and it was super oily. also, the portion was not worth it for the price
author: Amy L.

description: The Lunch Specials are a great deal. For a rice plate you get soup (meh), salad, appetizer and entrée with rice (I like brown rice).  You choose an appetizer, I like the fish cakes or chicken satay, and the kind of protein with your entrée (tofu, chicken, beef, pork, seafood or prawns).  The one I like is the eggplant with prawns or chicken, my husband likes the ginger.  There's quite a few choices and curries too.  Lunch costs between $10 -12.  Service is great and the place is usually quiet for good conversation.
author: Linda L.

description:
Close your eyyyyes, amieee,
And you can beeeeeee wihith meee!
'Neath the waaaves, through the caaaaves!
I'm hot. ter. than. a. sum. mer. day.
Sting raaaay, Sugar Raaay
Knu! ckles! all. up. in. yo. faaace!

As much as I wanted to eat actually IN the resto behind the Dirty Dancing-esque neon window logo, I had to get takeout so I could catch the Boz Scaggs vs Missy Elliott showdown that was rabble-rousing its way through my home speakers.

#4 GREEN ONION PANCAKES $5.95: I was expecting pajeon, but it was puff pastry triangles. They should change the name; croritos (croissant x Doritos) could be pretty hot right now.
(photo http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uJnr3RNJdChGUqc8CtFLNA&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA)

#53 MO MONEY MO PRA-RAMS CHICKEN $8.95: I chose the hottest spice level. Yawn. The dish was deece though - not too much chick, not too much veg.
(photo http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=caHszcFbuLiNHxj_2fhXUQ&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA)

I should go back and dine in at some point. I'm keeping an eye out for the #62 STILL SHAVE MY CHO CHA RED SNAPPER.
author: Dan B.

description:
My roommates have dissuaded me from eating here, and the Yelp reviews were average. When I saw  my neighbor purchase some food for pick up, I decided I needed to make my own informed decision. 

I ordered Pad Thai and egg rolls, customer favorites on Eat 24. The spicy level of the Pad Thai was mild, but I wish I ordered it medium because it had no flavor. I thought it was just me, paying more attention to Game 2 of the NBA finals instead of my meal.  But alas, it really didn't have any flavor. The egg rolls were okay too. Most of the flavor came from the sweet and sour sauce. 

I'll probably try this place one more time so hopefully tonight was just an off night.
author: Vira P.

description:
Fast delivery 
Food was super hot upon delivery and everything tasted lovely. The spring rolls were deliciously fresh and crispy & loved how the veggie spring rolls don't have mushrooms! Had the Thai green curry which was also nice. Reasonably priced too.
author: Emma G.

description: Very welcoming environment. Waitress was friendly and helpful. You can feel the love from little details like the paper rose and cute plates. (See pics) Food is yummy~ I had fried chicken wings with basil. Love the crispy basil on top!! Tom yum soup and silver noodle salad were good~
author: Maddy L.

description: Pretty average (bordering mediocre) Thai place in the Outer Richmond. I ordered pad see ew when I came here for dinner, and I thought it was very under seasoned. It was a pretty big entree, but I didn't really enjoy it that much. I thought it could've used a lot more sauce in the way the noodles were cooked and not how I usually see pad see ew made. I thought the Thai tea was good though!
author: Steph V.

description:
This place has great service and friendly staff!  It's apart of EAT24 so they deliver!

I ate too many Gu Chomps on my long run and the caffeine ended up upsetting my stomach at mile 9.  I was supposed to go 10 miles that day but after holding in my upset stomach, I had to find a bathroom.  I had just finished running downhill through the Presidio and the residential area so I was desperate.

I saw that Clement Street had businesses open for dinner on Sunday and ran into this restaurant.  I quickly ordered a Thai tea to go and went to the bathroom.  After calming my upset stomach, I drank a glass of water and the rest of the Thai tea happily as I walked another mile back to my car parked at Golden Gate Park.

The End.
author: Chris L.

description: I had really great fried rice, lots of flavor and different vegetables. I'm not the biggest fan of spicy foods so sometimes Thai can be hard but the restaurant had a lot of options on the menu. Felt like a pretty standard neighborhood eatery in the Richmond. Staff was great and helpful. The papaya salad was a refreshing way to start the meal with some Thai iced tea!
author: Kylie B.

description:
My partner, who is from Thailand, and I visited 11 different Thai restaurants in San Francisco, looking for the right mix of good food, intimate location and friendly staff.   It helps, of course, that he speaks fluent Thai.  

We chose Patpong Thai for our after wedding ceremony dinner seating 24 people.   We met with Sak the night before and selected our menu.  There were some special requests required as two guests were Vegan and one had strong allergies to anything fish (including fish sauce used for many dishes).   The staff suggested buffet style, but we insisted on family style seating and serving (3 groupings)

We were extremely pleased with the at the end of the evening and all of our guests greatly appreciated the high quality and taste of the food we selected.   It was a challenge to serve the 7 courses family style, but the staff rose to the occasion and the kitchen really performed extraordinarily.   We were very pleased with this business and appreciated EVERTHING they did to make the evening special for us as well as our guests.
author: Justin Thomas A.

description: Delicious! This is an outstanding Thai restaurant. They have the best Tom Khar and Green Curry I've ever tasted. Very nice staff.
author: Debbie N.

description: For the price, it's a 10/10 Thai joint! My go to for take out or fast sit down.  The Pad Thai and Pra Ram always a go too!
author: Devin H.

description:
My family was feeling thai food the other night and we saw this place across the street so we ventured in and tried it. The restaurant was completely empty, all they had were a bunch of take out orders near the door for people who ordered ahead of time.
Now for the food. Surprisingly, I liked the pineapple fried rice the most! It was full of flavor even though it was just fried rice. The noodles and curry we ordered were okay. The curry tasted super watered down, and the noodles were either very saucy or oily..
They also give you a thai tea for checking in! Remember to mention that you checked in to redeem it before you order it or else they will not allow you to redeem it AFTER you order, which is a bit odd but whatever.
This place was just average, there are better thai restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Kev L.

description: Decent honey roasted duck, but the portions were smallish.  Good service.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I'm afraid.

I'm afraid to write a positive review of this restaurant, as it will tip the scales just a bit closer to wonderful, and then it will be flooded by nimrods, bent on finding the next hip place, based on stars, their "foodie" friends, and long lines. 

With that in mind, I will say nothing to bolster your knowledge of the generous portions, tasty, although not overly-spiced curries, and seafood based delights. I choose not to declare that this establishment is the best, in the very Thai restaurant  prevalent neighborhood. 

In fact, this place pales to the amazingnessness of Burma Superstar, or Ike's, or Taqueria Cancun, or The Stinking Rose, or any of the other crappy restaurants that the masses rave over, because their friends said so.

So yeah. Stay away. This spot is mine.
author: Darrell L.

description:
I'm definitely a fan! 

My roommate and I were walking around for some good dinner when we stumbled upon this place. So glad we did! 

We got the Tom Yum soup and the Shrimp Pad Thai.
Both were delicious, large, and we left full and happy.
Overall, here's how I broke everything down:

PROS:
*Great friendly service
*Yummy food
*Clean environment

CONS:
*Music was a bit soft, it made our talking feel really loud and a bit awkward, but that's my only problem, this place was great.
author: Cara O.

description: I'm a regular customer here and I order the food about once or twice a month. I have never eating inside but always order for delivery . I stick with what I like and always order the red curry chicken with vegetables , for some reason the lady who Answers my call always make mistakes , forget my chicken couple times and I was very disappointed . I assume when a regular customer orders the same thing all the time , she should know already .i work in a upscale restaurant myself and I am a manager of the business . When a customer requires certain things it's better just reply politely and correct it instead of arguing back and forth . She was constantly arguing about the order instead of saying ok I will let the driver deliver it for you. It's totally wasting of time . I suggest when you make a phone order , repeat 3 times on the phone so you don't get something you don't want . Especially calling between 5 to 8 pm . Food overall is good but bad customer service .
author: Lidia W.

description:
Although Patpong is a tiny space, they've managed to turn it into a chic restaurant.  The interiors are are modernized with slender openwork wood dividers along one wall to give a minimal sense of privacy, smooth wood flooring, granite tabletops and sleek styled seating.  The walls and front hostess area are adorned with exotic,authentic Thai motifs.

Now for the food!  My gf and I both had lunch specials for $7.95 which came with soup, salad, an appetizer and an entree.  What a deal!  Both of us decided on the Eggplant basil dish with red pepper, mushroom, onions and a choice of meat.  I had the duck for and extra $2.  It was so good, I could have inhaled it had her and I not been chatting it up!  The appetizers:  The fried wontons were light and lacked any greasiness.  -crunchy morsels of joy...  The fish cakes  were a little on the stiff side but okay with good flavor.  It had a texture closer to a fish ball which I'm not a fan of.  The salad was plain with a hint of a sweet dressing which was hardly noticeable, but I typically enjoy very light dressing on salads anyways.  The service was friendly but a bit slow in the beginning.  However, it was understandable given there was only one server during lunch hour.

I would definitely return next time I'm in the area.  This place is aesthetically pleasing, friendly and serves good food.  What's not to like?!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Have been a longtime customer (delivery only) and was a big fan, especially of the Spicy Basil Tofu. The last time we ordered we had dinner the first night and were finishing up the leftovers on the second night when much to my horror I found a DEAD COCKROACH in my food. I'm not sure I'll ever want to order take out again...
author: Margaret W.

description:
This is my jam! I, like the majority of the population in san francisco, love thai food. This is my local place, i've been to every thai spot in the richmond, and yeah king of thai is cool, but for a local in the richmond, this place is it. Chicken wings w/ fried basil leaves. pad thai, pumpkin curry w/ duck, pad kee mao, pad see eew, duck fried rice. These are all the things i like. 

This is the only place I have saved on my phone for a restaurant. phone to table in 20 minutes. I love america.
author: Elton F.

description:
Quick delivery. My spring rolls and pad thai got here after just 30 mins. The rolls are fresh, crispy and delish. The pad thai, while not amazing, was good. 

I plan on being a repeat customer!
author: Chef C.

description:
Down the street from me, ordered take out---was fast & efficient---restaurant was empty.

Veggie egg rolls: large portion for relatively cheap price, bland and greasy, tastes sorta like late night fast food chinese from a food court. 

Veggie Pad Kee Mao: tasty, good flavor, nice ratio veggies to noodles but small portion (or I am just a heifer) or both. A little spendy for what it is.
author: Cec D.

description:
Had to put in a good word for this place.  We have found our new lunch delivery spot, after tiring of the general un-flavorliness of Tsing Tao (and also the unfortunate discovery of a hair in my coworker's lunch)....and it is Patpong.  We all ordered chicken pad thai the first time (to accurately judge a thai place, you need to try it, right?) and I thought it was really good.  Good flavor, not greasy, a good amount of crushed peanuts on top, and a generous takeout portion which easily provided me with two meals.

The next time, we ordered delivery for about 15 people for a lunch talk.  They carefully labeled each dish with the person's name on it, and not a mistake was made...on 15 orders.  Maybe I just have low expectations from delivery, but I was pretty impressed.  And everyone's food arrived, on time, and piping hot.  A+!  Everyone gobbled up their lunches happily, and most had leftovers for the next day.  I ordered the spicy basil chicken which was the right amount of spiciness - not burning my mouth off, but definitely with a kick.

Since that order went so well, we ordered again the same week.  This time I went back to chicken pad thai, again, perfectly satisfying the craving.  My two coworkers (one who is Korean and loves spice) ordered their dishes spicy.  And oh my goodness were they!  We had just taken a few bites when both of them started sweating and needed to get an ice-cold drink from the vending machine.  However, they really liked it.  I will be sure never to order anything "spicy" from them, though!

We'll definitely be back.  It's our go-to spot for lunch delivery in the Richmond!
author: Caroline K.

description: Delivery is cheep and fast enough, but the Panang curry was NOT very good. Thin curry with little taste. Meet was ok but the curry dish doesn't even come with rice!
author: Chris R.

description:
delicious food! they are so nice whenever i walk in to pick up food togo and fast!
Ive come back several times.
Love it!
author: Sarah J.

description:
This is my go to Thai restaurant!  Service is always fast whether dining in or using delivery.  

My favorite order is the yellow chicken curry and garlic rice.  The pad see ew, Thai fried rice, and pad Thai is delicious too!  The service is always great. 

Highly recommended.
author: Shae O.

description: Excellent lunch here. Curious that we were the only ones here. We would definitely come again
author: George Y.

description: We ordered the beef salad and the garlic chicken.  Both dishes were flavorless, unthoughtful and just seemed lazy.
author: mark l.

description:
Ehhhh. Their food is pretty mediocre. There just was not enough flavor in the things I tried. Also, every time I get a chicken dish, the chicken is a bit on the dry side. The only thing I'll come back here for are the shrimp rolls - they're the best ones I've ever had. 
There are plenty of other Thai restaurants just across the park in the Sunset that are much better.
author: Allison D.

description: Eat lunch here regularly. Always fast. Always great. Year after year. The server is a joy.
author: Noel S.

description:
I have been going to Patpong for over 8 years at least once a week.
I spend a lot of money there.
To go or eating inside.
One night that I am sick and that I asked them nicely to deliver me food, they are refusing to deliver for $4 missing on their minimum, which is $15 , I live on 29th and clement and they 3 blocks from my house.
After having me in their system for over 8 years and being treated like a total stranger is HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I WILL NEVER RETURN !
The most amazing part is that they don t care.
author: Matia S.

description:
Love this place's service and tasty dishes. Everyone who works here is super nice, right down to the management/owner who, I'm pretty sure, delivered a meal to us at 10 pm on a Saturday. 

I recommend the pineapple fried rice, crispy chicken fried rice, shrimp rolls and FOR GOODNESS' SAKE the mango sticky rice.
author: Christina R.

description: I'm sad. Why does it always have to come to this?? A one star would never happen if I was at least moderately satisfied, but no. On to the review. Ordered delivery. Green curry and chicken pad Thai and added shrimp. The green curry was watery as hell and bland. I had to add salt to get some flavor. The pad Thai tasted ok but I asked to add shrimp and they added TWO little shrimp. Really? I'm not about that. That's rude cause I paid extra for it. But now I know. I may just give it one more try if I'm absolutely desperate and not close to Kin khao downtown, but I highly doubt it.
author: mel l.

description:
I think it is fair to say that my obsession with Patpong is real. I used to live down the street, and would order take out here at LEAST once a week. Now, I live in Oakland, and still come here when I get a chance. VEGETARIANS: do not miss the Pon Ga Ree! Best curry I've ever had. It's not spicy, but full of flavor, which is the key to my heart. 

I would rate them 4 stars because they had a delivery guy who once gave me a menu to a different thai place and told me to order from there instead, LOLZ. But this love is unbreakable. Silly delivery guy, you'll never get between us. But whatevs, I currently have my mouth full of Pon Ga Ree so0o0o.... #notevenmad

Moral of the story: eat here!
author: Alyssa L.

description: Love this place. Great thai food. Pad see ewe and the pad thai are very well prepared. My favorite dish however is the wings. So good!
author: Daniel F.

description: Hubby is currently in SF Veterans Hospital. I had Veggie Green, steamed rice and Thai iced coffee delivered. It arrived hot and was delicious! No delivery charge (though they did charge me 10 cents for the bag... Which cracked me up!) I did take a star off only because it arrived with no napkin or silverware. I will order them again, I know. I will just stress that I need silverware!
author: Alan K.

description:
Patpong provides solid Thai food with quick service and convenient delivery.

One of the great things about this place is that it never seems to be crowded, even during peak hours for lunch and dinner.  This is probably because most customers either order over the phone for pickup or delivery due to its convenient location in the Richmond district.

There are many neighboring restaurants within the vicinity so the options are out there should you decide on something else.  Parking can sometimes be tough since this is one of the busier parts of the Richmond.

The space is medium-sized but as previously mentioned, seating is never a problem.  The decor is pretty standard for a Thai restaurant with your Buddhist statues and various plants laid out to give it that ethnic and traditional feel.

Their lunch menu is a perfect quick fix for that Thai craving, such as the crab meat or roasted duck fried rice, or any of the clay pot dishes.  The pad thai and the pad see ew are also pretty good.

One of my favorite main entrees is the herbal red snapper which is sauteed in special herb sauce, bamboo shoots, baby corn, bell peppers, eggplant, green beans, zucchini, and Thai basil on a sizzling plate.
author: Tony L.

description:
I've been here twice and our waitresses are always nice and attentive, but the food lacks flavor. The first time I ordered fried chicken over garlic fried rice - fried chicken was soggy and the fried rice tasted too plain. Second time I had the pad thai: it was way too tangy with too many noodles and not enough veggies and meat.

On top of that, I checked in on Yelp right after I ordered during my second visit and was granted an offer for a free Thai iced tea, yet they refused to honor the coupon. So they made me pay for the Thai iced tea I drank during my meal, and gave me another iced tea to in a plastic to-go cup. What the f***, how hard is it to enter your computer system and delete a drink off the tab?

After reading through other reviews on Yelp, it seems like the general idea is that Patpong refuses to take an extra step to establish a clientele. Its a disappointment cause I want to like this place, I really do - its clean, the food is marginally acceptable, and its within walking distance of my home, but they have no loyalty and their food isn't good enough to overlook that. Spend your money else and treat yourself to better Thai food by driving further down Clement for King of Thai.
author: Felix C.

description:
Zero stars ! I've been coming here for almost 6 months since they are my neighborhood Thai food .Today I ordered a pad see ew chicken Togo, when I went home I ate half the dish when suddenly I smelled and taste something spoiled and funky- it was the Chinese green broccoli. I walked back to the restaurant and told the waiter. 

They said they cannot do anything about it because I ate half the noodles and that was the problem

i told her the problem was that they served me expired vegetables to begin with

The owner came and said pad see ew is their most popular dish ,he said I was wrong and they never serve spoil food. 

He never even apologize, just dissed me and was in denial. They have no restaurant or business Ethnics or customer service. 
No wonder they have a 78 HEALTH SCORE Gross . Don't go here. 

The dish was only 10$ but they lost a neighborhood customer forever.

No wonder their business is so slowwww. 

Go to king of Thai instead
author: Quyen T.

description:
Over the years, the service has gone up and down. It's on an up again. The food is always good. The prices are great.

 The atmosphere is excellent. A serene place for dining and company. A favorite place of mine to bring guests when you wish to sit and talk over dinner. Cannot tolerate loud noisy restaurants. 

 One of the best places for lunch on the Outer Clement Corridor.
author: Karen H.

description: Great food, super friendly service, and nice atmosphere. We'll definitely make this a go-to spot when we eat Thai food.
author: Kayla G.

description:
Wow! This Thai restaurant is really authentic! I brought my in-laws for dinner and they loved it! Fried chicken wings and basil Thai rice are the bomb! Friendly people too.
Will be going back again next week.
author: Liza M.

description:
Interesting night:  my wife and I decided 1) we had no interest in cooking dinner, and 2) we felt like driving to 25th and clement, getting out of the car, and randomly picking a restaurant to eat at.  There's a bunch of options on that short stretch of clement, and we stumble upon Patpong Thai and decided to check it out.

They have good stuff here.  I ordered the pad thai with crab meats, and it was one of the least oily, lightest pad-thai's I've had in the city.  I'm not saying that's how pad thai is supposed to be, but at 8pm on a worknight, and after eating a giant pile of pad thai, I didn't feel like passing out on the spot, which was good.

My wife ordered the eggplant chicken, and she was fully impressed as well.

This place won't knock your socks off, but if you're hungry and have a hankering for thai food, it's worth it.  Decent prices, good service, and tasty dishes - works for us.
author: Tim N.

description: This is best Thai in outer richmond, I've tried them all. Pad see eww was solid. Spicy basil chicken and rice great! The lady that's always there is so nice!
author: Blake S.

description: Now it's pretty good service and clean. However. The menu has remained the same for years and certain dishes are quite good, though now lower quality than before. Crab cakes and the Tom Khar soup are my favorite. Tries chicken with rice noodles but it did not differ much from what you could get at a chinese place. Overall, ok.
author: Alan G.

description:
Craving coconut.

Definitely in 100+ degree Myanmar. Fresh coconut water was a highlight from an incredible trip to an incredible country: www.sfgate.com/travel/article/Experience-newly-open-Burma-before-the-crush-3705543.php

Not so much otherwise. Which made Patpong's non-coconut milk curry Gang-Pa Curry an easy choice.

Lighter curry meant more focus on the salmon, bell peppers, zucchini, pumpkin, green beans and broccoli. Delicious medley with a nice balance of each.

Hoped for a bit larger quantity for the $12 price plus tax and tip. Quality was not an issue. Nor was the very friendly and welcoming staff.

Thai food cravings can be satisfied here. For coconut cravings I can't recommend Myanmar enough.
author: Jason B.

description: We stopped by after visiting my dad at the va hospital. The food was amazing.  Great taste at a great price.
author: Paul S.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco! My wife and I order from here about once a week. The Pra Ram and the Ka Pao are our favorite dishes! The curries are also very delicious. And of course you have to get the garlic rice. The food is  Very flavorful, the meat is fresh, there is a great selection, and they have great prices. The staff is also very friendly.
author: Josh T.

description: This place is just one block away from my apartment so I have to admit that I am slightly biased due to shear convenience.  Aside from the location, the food is pretty good.  We always go with the Pad Thai (which could use a little more flavor).  They do a great job at cooking the tofu and egg rolls are quite tasty.  The best dish I've gotten here is the Basil Chicken.  It has great flavors and just enough spice.  The worst dish I've gotten here has been the Cashew Chicken.  There is nothing terribly wrong with the cashew chicken just slightly flavorless.  Overall, I still give this place credit for being a great Thai place with fantastic customer service.  They can give off a fast-food-Thai flavor, but the prices are great.
author: Samuel B.

description: I've eaten in person as well as gotten delivery from here.  Their food is decent.  Delivery service is prompt.  One time the delivery person got lost (miscommunication between cashier and him about my location) but otherwise quite reliable.
author: SF O.

description:
Larb: no mint in a "herb" salad? only had green onions in it... no mint... still upset...
Pad Thai: flavorless noodles, no green onions, no onions, noodles were not mixed well with the other ingredients. no "usual" lime to go with it... not exactly sure if it was any better than the box kind of pad thai...
Chicken Wings: got these for my friends so I can't entirely comment but it looked promising with fried basil leaves; it was a wet rub, coated with some red sauce. She said it was sweet and sour'y but I cannot confirm or deny.

Not ordering from them again. Timing was fine. Estimated time was an hour (order was placed at 11:40ish) and it showed up as estimated.
author: Vicki T.

description: I ordered to go and it came quickly, but the food was mediocre. The noodles stuck together, and the rice dish had big chucks of carrots it in. I give them credit for having brown rice available.
author: David B.

description: Great neighborhood Thai restaurant with an excellent lunch special.
author: Jen S.

description: Great food, good service, good price. We got the spicy chicken wings, duck curry, fried wantons, and pad see eww (drunken noodles) and everything was great. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting thai in sf.
author: Evan F.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 4.5 Stars
Average: 4 Stars
 
+ Lunch Specials
+ Inexpensive
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Very Clean
+ Spacious

+/- Quiet

[W] We came here by accident I would say. We were actually planning to go to the lunch buffet at the India Clay Oven restaurant but we missed it by half an hour..........so I looked across the street, said "babe you want Thai?" she said yea sure and here we are haha. This place was surprisingly good and I'm glad we ate here. When we when in, we were greeted very nicely by the host and he let us sit down anywhere.
 
[M] The restaurant is nice but very quiet even with the Thai music playing in the background. It was good though because we didn't have to talk over anyone's voice. Today we had the lunch specials which was a great deal for a lot of food. Wayne ordered the Spicy Basil and Veggie Eggrolls over rice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5HoFK6YbKYjrVjeAp34puA?select=KKUUo8hLgKOhxtZnVKCPtQ while I had the Green Curry with Chicken Satay http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5HoFK6YbKYjrVjeAp34puA?select=Pok4Cg6E3-B_dEoBIttoDQ. Our lunch also comes with a side salad and salty and sour veggie soup http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5HoFK6YbKYjrVjeAp34puA?select=J7g-Y0mGBNoolhJ0ze5H0w which was pretty good also. 
 
[W] Other than the fact that the peanut sauce being too alcohol-ish, everything was really good. I really enjoyed my dish which was flavorful and saucy. The meat had a lot of sauce, which is a plus, and the eggrolls were fresh and crispy MMm MMmm. If I had a chance I will definitely eat here again. The server was really nice and the food was good. Again I'm glad we found a new spot to eat!
author: Mona C.

description:
I have only been here once and it was not bad. I have had better thai food. I base how good thai food is by pad thai and then so on and so forth, just because pad thai is a main dish and you would surprised how different it can vary among restaurants. 

Their pad thai was okay, it had some different tastes that I wasnt use to. I cant pin point it. I also had tried some of m friends yellow curry which was quite decent as well. I had the duck, it was nice and moist and thankfully not dry. My friend enjoyed her chicken satay.

The service here was good, it wasn't very busy, its small, which i believe most Thai restaurants are. I would come back to try more dishes and make another judgement.
author: Michelle H.

description: I'm a flight nurse and try and find all the good Thai food next to our receiving hospitals on the way back.  This place was great!  Quick service, excellent food, and a free Thai tea with a check in.  Will be back next time we drop off at the VA :)
author: Luke S.

description: Got pad thai, cucumber salad, and steamed white rice delivered. Took 45ish minutes and my pad thai was hard and the noodles were stuck together. I was eating it in noodle chunks! It was also unlike any other pad thai I've had in that it was more chicken-tasting? Even though it was shrimp and tofu...but I guess it was okay. The cucumber salad was yummy!
author: Tania C.

description:
The restaurant is attractive and the service is good. We had an OK lunch, nicely presented. Unfortunately, the kitchen radio was blaring the whole time. We were the only patrons in the restaurant and didn't feel like we could ask to have it turned off. 

Lunch was unpleasant. Their food would have to be a whole lot better for us to go back again and put up with the noise.
author: James V.

description:
This place is OK. Food is Ok. Service is OK. 

I would give this place 3 stars except it is pretty horrific that they charge for white rice for my lunch to-go order. My beef and string beans came with NO RICE. What kind of thai place serves lunch and gives you no rice!!??? Sorry. Definitely gonna try other options before stopping here to order my lunch.
author: Mai H.

description: This place is very consistent, very quick, family owned, and probably the best thai in the richmond (and I've tried a ton of them). I'm baffled as to why they aren't packed every night. Highly recommend.
author: Frankie S.

description: Love this thai place. We ordered pad thai, green curry with veggies and brown rice, crab cakes and fried chicken. The green curry was amazing. I didn't know you could choice your spice level. I probably got the regular and it was so flavorful with a kick at the end. Everyone at our table loved it. The pad thai had a great sauce. Also, the cucumber salad served with the crab cakes is to die for. The dressing is fantastic. Will definitely be back. Fast service.
author: Anna M.

description: I first started ordering here a year ago for delivery and the food was AWESOME! But this last couple times I ordered food it was AWFUL!! I don't know what happened! I ordered the thai toast which i normally got before which was truly amazing and the last time it tasted like a rubber tire like burnt plastic or something, it was awful, I couldn't eat it!! So I thought maybe it was just a bad cook that day or something...tried again and got the wontons instead and they tasted exactly the same as the crappy thai toast I got before! Ugh, this food used to be amazing and now it sucks, I'm not even going to bother trying again. It's a shame!
author: Sarah D.

description: FAST delivery. I have tried most other Thai in the area and so far this is all around the best. The spicy chicken wings come with 8 wings. The pic on eat24 is inaccurate. They are crispy but covered in spicy sweet-ish sauce. The spring rolls are five rolls with a nice light sweet-sour sauce. Liquid not sticky. Rolls are crispy and not oily compared to most other delivery rolls. I asked for several substitutions in my rice and curry orders and everything came just as I ordered. And the delivery guy was nice! I will be ordering from here again.
author: j s.

description: Service was great, but the food was not up to par. The soup that came with lunch was very sour. The grilled chicken was dry. I had many Tom yum noodle before and this place was by far the worst.
author: Vera W.

description: There are a lot of Thai places like Patpong in SF - a little bit above average, inexpensive food that will not change your life, but will leave you satisfied. Patpong is one I like a little more than the others, especially for delivery in the Richmond. Nearly every time I order from them, it comes so quickly it almost seems impossible. Friendly folks, too.
author: Matt C.

description:
I love to come into the Richmond District at night as the thinning professional crowd coincides with the thickening waves of rolling fog coming from the ocean. Without much foot traffic, it gets particularly chilly walking in this neighborhood while others flock toward the Inner Richmond or other parts of San Francisco for a warmer cozy dinner. As a wealth seeker in the most unlikely places, I often go in the opposite direction from the places that bring in a crowd. This and an advice from my good friend B.B brought me here for an evening of Thai cuisine. There is nothing more comforting than to walk in and out of the cold with a warm ambiance and spicy food waiting to indulge my curious mind and empty stomach.

The restaurant was gorgeous. It had all the characteristics such as dim lighting, dark wooden floors, sleek tables, and nice dining sets with warm candle light to induce an exquisite intimate atmosphere. It reminded me of Wuong Luang Thai of Concord where everything in the backdrop had an aesthetic purpose. Sometimes I feel apprehensive about going into such a nice restaurant by myself but since there were only a few people it was easy for me to swoop in without causing an odd spectacle.

Contrary to what I might have expected from such a fancy restaurant where a table for one could render one's invisibility in the eyes of the servers, the two people who were there actually gave me a strong sense of belonging as they were highly attentive, warm, and knowledgeable. I was initially disappointed when they ran out of fried taro appetizer but instead my orders of fresh rolls ($6.95) and poh turn ($12.95) were a pleasant surprise. My pair of fresh rolls came with a mixture of cucumbers, bean sprouts, tofu, eggs, and mushrooms wrapped in fresh egg roll skin topped with tamarind sauce with a dab of real crab meat. With the wrappers served warm and fluffy, the taste of sprouts, mushrooms, and eggs really stood out while still submissive to the tamarind's sweet and savory accent. For the price I thought the crab meat was rather decorative and could be more elaborative and integral to the overall experience.

While some restaurants hold back on its authenticity by succumbing to the mainstream palate, my poh turn arrived just the way I liked it: Spicy bodacious and yelpalicious. With strong lemon grass, kaffir lime leaves, galangale root, and chili peppers anchoring a good mixture of prawns, scallops, fish, calamari and mussels, this dish sizzled. While portions were small, this dish grappled with my imagination with its sharp, spicy, and sour flavors that was jaw dropping delicious. I loved to eat my Thai food with sticky rice ($2) and thought it was a decent complement to such a flavorful dish. 

To further add to the experience, my cup of water was never empty and they were very attentive by making warm eye contacts with one arm folded to the back as a part of being great hostesses. They also surprised me in the end with a free pumpkin dessert with warm coconut milk to give my dinner the appropriate finish. In the end when I asked for a take out menu, instead of pointing to the stack at the door, the server went out of his way to bring me a copy. In terms of good customer service, this was one form of personalization that will keep bringing me back. 

Besides these strong attributes, I thought their prices could be lowered and portions could be more generous. Otherwise, this place deserves a very strong 4 stars for its wonderful unyielding flavors and unparalleled dining experience. I promised B.B. that I would come back for their spicy crispy chicken wings and hopefully by then they will also have the taro appetizers too.
author: Daniel L.

description: Eat here about once a week! Love the spring rolls, crispy chicken wings, green papaya salad, ginger tofu, cripsy garlic chicken over rice. Love it all!!!
author: Lady G.

description: Worst Thai food I've ever had. On top of that, we waited 2.5 hrs for delivery to come. I would never recommend this place.
author: Miranda B.

description: not what we expacted .. pumpkin curry..13$? Only two pumpkin and not even handful beef.. only lot of soup...and the favor is not good like the Thai restaurant I used to have... too sweet...and all in all I think I can make better myself at home ...... go to king of Thai!!
author: Roxy T.

description: This is my first time doing a review here but I've been here before.. This time it was a let down.. The times before the food was good but this time it was far from good.. It was pretty plain and not worth even going back for..Tom Yum soup was inconsistent and not very good. Pad Sew Yew was good but the veggies in it weren't even cooked consistently.. Some where still raw while some were cooked just right. This time the food was a letdown.. I am sure I will not be back..seems like they have a hit or miss type of service.. Some days it will be a hit but this time it was a miss..your mileage may vary..
author: Kiel V.

description: I have been getting food from here for a while, the service is always very nice.the food was good in the beginning, but lately there's been a decline in the food. It's becoming very flavorless. We ordered from here the other night delivered , It got here fast and hot ,but it all taste the same.
author: Pat C.

description:
This place wasn't all too bad when I stopped by here the other day with the boo!  It was much better sitting in the restaurant than it is delivered I can tell you this!  

I ordered the pumpkin curry, which wasn't too bad.  It definitely could've been spicier in general, and it was just a tad bit bland, but not all bad at all! My boo ordered the prick king, which wasn't bad either, but it didn't taste as good as I tasted it last time at this restaurant though.  The food was barely average, but like I said, the delivery isn't very good though =/... maybe because the food already got too cold when it got to your place or what...?  I don't know. 

 What at least sets things right is the service.  The lady who served us was friendly and helpful.  However, I don't think I'd be going back to this establishment because the food hasn't improved.  They have plenty of customers because they deliver so I think their business should be fine, but if you want some good Thai I suggest dining elsewhere if you're sitting in that is.
author: John H.

description: We stopped in to get some takeout right around the time that they'd closed for lunch, but the super friendly server told us it wouldn't be an issue. She sat us down, got us some water, and in just 15 minutes, we had to-go containers and utensils ready to go. Only issue was that by the time we got our food to the park, prepared to dig in, the sauces had nearly soaked through the bottom of the to-go containers and had turned all of the napkins into a soggy blob. It was a bit of a mess, so we kind of had to rush chowing it all down, eating out of the plastic bag it all came in. Bummer, but still tasty. My advice? Eat at the restaurant.
author: Stefanie J.

description:
Heard some good reviews about this place in the past so I thought I would check it out.

Has to be the worst experience I have ever had at the many restaurants I have ever been to. I ordered their veggie spring rolls and when I bit into my 2nd roll.......

I BIT INTO A BOLT. YES A BOLT!!!!!

 I would have to say a 10m and about an inch long

The owner could not explain why and how it got in there. I got up and walked out. 

Will never go back!!
author: Jon S.

description: I ate here with my boyfriend on our last day visiting San Francisco, the last weekend of May. We had the Shrimp Rolls, Thai Toast, Fisherman's Choice,  and the Pad Kee Mao (seafood combo), along with Thai iced teas. Everything was was really great, the seafood was nice and fresh and for Thai food (I love Thai food) it was super yummy. I also ordered a side of peanut sauce and they came out with basically a small cream dish filled with peanut sauce, it was awesome! It was also reasonably priced, I would totally recommend this place!
author: Melinda F.

description:
We got in right when they opened at 5:30pm and they weren't excited to see us. 
The spring rolls were overly peppery, unlike any spring rolls I've had.
The shrimp pad thai and cashew chicken was good.

thai iced tea was yummy - and only 1.75 !

Wouldn't crave this food and they seemed much more excited to see us leave, we got a very nice goodbye from the staff. :)
author: Lora J.

description: I am a regular at Patpong and get take out from them all of the time. It's my go to, too tired to cook after a long day of work place in my neighborhood, and it always hits the spot! The women who work here are the best. They are just so sweet and kind. I always get the eggplant chicken, add green beans, with brown rice which is delicious, as is the fried sweet potatoes and all of the soups. Thank you for always being there like a dependable, comforting friend, Patpong!
author: Ben S.

description:
For Thai food delivery, I normally go with King of Thai. Great taste, great portions and reasonably priced. But heck, Patpong is closer to our Outer Richmond address so I figured I'd send some business their way.

Ordering was easy, they have their menu online and the descriptions are clear. Phone order was good so no problems there. Delivery was free so even better. I ordered 5 dishes - spring rolls, tom yum soup, Thai style fried rice with chicken, spicy basil duck and prawns with spring peas. A decent selection from the menu right? Well, when we got the food, it was a big disappointment. Who said the portions are huge? They must not have been talking about the delivery servings. For the price, since we got these puny portions, I thought maybe the quality and taste is worth it. WRONG. Nothing made my tastebuds go "YUM". Even the Tom Yum soup didn't do that and it has YUM in the name! King of Thai Noodle's Tom Yum soup has a lot more goodies in the soup like lemongrass and huge pieces of ginger so you know its real. Patpong's version made me wonder if it was yesterday's left overs.

Patpong, we gave you a chance and you didn't deliver. Don't worry, when I walk by, I'll still wave through the window.
author: Mark M.

description:
This is a solid place for Thai food if you are in the neighborhood.  The food was very good: I had the pumpkin red curry and fish cakes.  I also tried the yellow curry and curry fried rice.  They were both good but nothings spectacular.  However the garlic calamari was amazing (from the specials board).  The breading was light and crispy (garlicy but not overwhelming so).  The calamari was in good sized pieces instead of rings and ooh so tender.

It was pretty empty when I went for lunch but there was a lot of delivery and carryout business.  Our server was very attentive and friendly.  The lunch specials were a great value and come with soup when you dine in. The plate presentation was simple but attractive.
author: Gwen C.

description:
Veggie Pad Thai for my friend here.

This is a great little place with an even better menu.  Lots of great appetizers as well as my favorite Papaya Salad.  They made it perfect, with thinly sliced papaya tossed in the classic sweet and tangy lime sauce with lots of chile peppers that made my lips fall off.  We warmed up with the Tom Yam, the hot and sour soup flavored with bits of lemongrass and red peppers.  The waitress kept hitting on my friend, who unfortunately, was gay, so I felt bad.  But she kept the food coming fast, and our last dishes were the Veggie Noodles with brown sauce and the Seafood Curry Sauce.  The noodles were my favorite thick wide rice noodles and the Seafood Curry brimming with shrimp.

We left, feeling a bit warmer and rounder to ward off the colder Sunset evening chill.
author: Miika M.

description:
I don't know why other people are raving about this place.
The appetizers are good (and cheap), but everything else is average at best.
Also except for the appetizers (normal size), many of the entree food portions are relatively small considering the prices they charge.

There are too many other better restaurants nearby, so this place is usually empty.
author: Luis C.

description:
The dish that I use to judge/rate all Thai restaurants is Pad See Ew.

Their menu is quite extensive for such a small little restaurant.  There are dishes with chicken, seafood, beef, and vegetables, and they had Pad Thai, other noodles, and about 4 different types of fried rice, including Pineapple Fried Rice.

Their Pad See Ew ($7.50) was delicious; just the right amount of sweetness, and the noodles were tender and didn't stick together.  The portion is just enough - usually I have a hard time finishing the dish at other Thai restaurants, but this was perfect for me.  I wish the chicken wasn't in such large chunks, because they took away my knife I think when they brought me the dish, and so I couldn't cut up the chicken.

Half star off for the waitstaff having family members around and therefore not really paying attention to us (no one came by to see if we needed anything).  They gave us some sticky rice with custard dessert on the house, and that was really delicious as well.

Overall 4.5 stars; definitely someplace I'd return to if I'm in the area.
author: Tori S.

description:
Small & cute dinning area.  I'd recommend this place to take a date for dinner if you don't want to get overly stuffed because the portions are way small (See pictures).  I've gotten more food for the same price at other Thai places I've gone to, but I guess you're paying for the ambiance. Plus, this place was just around the corner of where I live. 

My friends and I all ordered some type of stir-fried noodles, and they were generous enough to let me have a bite so that I can rave about it on Yelp: 

-I shared the chicken Pad See Ewe (noodles with sweet soy sauce), which was just ok...sorta plain. Probably wouldn't order that again. 

-Another ordered the Crab Meat Pad Thai, which I liked because they used real crab meat and the lemony aftertaste left my taste buds dancing. 

-Another ordered the Pad Kee Mao (noodles with spicy sauce), but after a couple of bites it was unbearably spicy for her.  But nonetheless, it had more flavor than the Pad See Ewe.
author: Lisa C.

description:
A couple of nights ago our workplace had a night event. My boss had completely forgotten that he was supposed to provide dinner, and was stuck in a meeting.

I frantically looked through a bunch of delivery menus and cross checked them with yelp. 

Pizza? No.
Chinese? No.

Thai? Hmm. yeah!

We ordered about $90 worth of fried rice (pineapple and thai style), noodle dishes (pad see ew: one veggie & one with beef. and pad thai)

(A) The food came in about 40-ish minutes. 

 (A++) The Pad see ew was THE BEST PAD SEE EW I've EVER had. When it comes to thai, I always get that plate. 

Sometimes when you eat noodles, you can tell it was quickly prepared when you're shifting through the noodles and see some white parts of the noodles. Though Patpong's pad see ew, every noodle and piece of beef was well marinated and cooked. No white parts. No chewy feeling.

Additionally, nothing felt too salty, sugary or oily. Which is a risk you take when you order delivery.

All my co-workers also loved the pad see ew and the other dishes. We will definitely buy lunch/dinner here again!
author: Sophia G.

description:
I only had their Panang Curry with chicken and some shrimp + basil.  Both were really tasty and decently priced.  It's a bit of a small shop but has nice decor and partitions between each booth that aren't really all that partition-y.

Side note: I did seem to get some sort of an allergic reaction, possibly nuts in the curry.  I asked before ordering and the waitress assured me there were none, still I got a mild reaction.

Times visited: 1
author: Amy L.

description:
Went here last night with a few friends. At first, we actually turned tail and walked away when we saw how empty the place was. Then we figured perhaps it was just too far away from the action and would be, as described by a local we met at the nearby Tee Off Bar, exceptional Thai food.

Alas, it wasn't. The place smelled a bit dank and there were flies (at first just one, but then the lonely guy was joined by two family members, or were they just friends?) buzzing around our heads. At first it was amusing - trying to catch them in our hands. But then the novelty wore off and we realized it's just plain gross.

Thankfully we only ordered the onion pancakes (greasy as we'd predicted). At least their Singha beer was delicious and cold but the coup de grace was when one of the flies pulled a kamikaze dive bomb into my half-full (I'm an optimist) beer. That's actually the first time that's ever happened to me inside a restaurant and I didn't quite know how to react.

I just felt sad. We left and went to a Japanese place down the street which also had a few flies but otherwise was quite good.

I hope these guys get it together - these are little problems that can be solved and I believe their food might be quite good.
author: Mike B.

description:
This place is quite good and the delivery is smoking fast (I'm only 5 blocks away). Definitely order #7 (Sa-tay) and #32 (Pad See Ewe).

This rating/review is based on food taste/delivery only.

Food: 4 stars
Delivery: Speed: 5 stars (25 min on a Sunday evening)
Value: 3 stars
Average: 4 stars

I have been meaning to try this neighborhood Thai place for a year or so now and finally decided to order some delivery from there and was very glad I finally did so. 

I tried 3 dishes to get a feel for the restaurant:
#7 Chicken Sa-tay: 5 stars! (this is one of the best I have ever had and the peanut sauce was mildly sweet but not crazy sweet like one reviewer said) - $7.95

#32 Beef Noodles With Sweet Soy Sauce (Pad See Ewe): 4.5 stars. Really a great dish. I really liked the wide noodles and the taste of the dish was neither too sweet nor oily. - $7.50

#48 Spicy Basil Pork (Gai Ka Pow): 3.75 stars. Good taste but very watery. Make sure you order rice on the side or try #28 with the rice mixed in (I haven't tried that one). #48 - $8.50

I liked that the food was not too oily like some places but the Ka Pow was a bit on the watery side. I actually found the dishes to be pretty average in size (lower value than most Chinese food but comparable to most Thai places I guess). One dish is plenty for one person but don't expect lots of leftovers unless you fill up on rice.

I found the food better than other Thai places in the area and I will definitely go back.
author: Mike L.

description:
Leaving the Legion of Honor two toddlers (niece & nephew) and three tried and cranky adults who were all very hungry and couldn't make up our minds on what to eat when we walked by this place and it just smelled awesome! We went crazy over the menu since everything sounded so good, I think we ended up ordering 7 dishes. Even my nephew who is a very picky eater ate! 
Since I live in Oakland I won't be able to go back as often as I would like, I know that I would make the trip out there again just for this place.
author: Kirsten C.

description:
Boyfriend has never liked thai food before, which I think is a travesty, so I took it upon myself to change this. We wound up at Patpong after walking around the neighborhood, and the restaurant looked inviting enough so we went in.

Servers were nice. Unfortunately that's about where the good part stops. I ordered Tom Yum soup and spring rolls and the boyfriend ordered pad see ew from my recommendation. I've never had a Tom Yum quite so terrible before (and I've had A LOT of Tom Yum). There was no hot or spicy or sour or really any good flavors at all - honestly it just tasted warm and overpoweringly fishy. The pad see ew was decent, but very bland. I think the best part were the spring rolls. 

Thoroughly unsatisfied, we left and decided to definitely not return. Boyfriend promises to give thai food one more shot before giving up, so I hope I pick a better place next time.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Nothing to complain about here. Cute place, great service, right price point. Its never really busy so they wait on you hand and foot. Ive only been here a couple of times, but I have tried several dishes and they have all been fantastic. The most recent trip we ordered:

Thai iced teas (ahem 2 for myself) - 5 stars
Yellow Chicken Curry - 4 stars
Chicken Basil - 3.5 stars
Cucumber salad - 4 stars (you cant really mess this up)
Thai 'french fries' - 4 stars

Seems like some people have issues with some of the food here, but most of what they ordered is actually Chinese. I don't know why Patpong is kidding themselves like that - stick to the Thai people!
author: Holl T.

description: My go to choice for thai delivery in the Richmond district.  Delivery is generally 45 minutes, but if you'd rather eat in the restaurant, the staff is very friendly and quick about taking orders and refilling drinks.  Recommended for a quiet sit down lunch or dinner experience (with the periodic phone calls from folks calling for delivery).  The coconut based soups and entrees are delicious for my vegetarian and meat eating friends alike.  My favorite dish is the ginger chicken.
author: Desiree C.

description: We came by here at lunch time, we really enjoyed the tasty meal. The place is cute, decent and clean. I highly recommend this place.
author: Sam A.

description:
We came here craving some Thai, and left pretty satisfied and full. 

The menu is fairly large here, allowing for a lot to choose from for those who might be adventurous and want to explore. In our case, we opted for the Spicy Basil Chicken, Chicken Pad Thai and a side order of rice. What we hadn't anticipated was that the portions were going to be large... especially the rice, which turned out to be a regular tub of it. Not only are the portions big, though, but they are also inexpensive and good.  That's a winning combo. The only downside is that the kitchen is nearly out in the open (hardly covered at all) and can get a little distracting with chatter during a meal, but that's a real small complaint.

All in all, this place was probably one of the better Thai restaurants we have been to. It gets a solid recommendation in the end.
author: Sami R.

description:
My friend and I originally wanted Sushi, but we forgot that most sushi restaurants don't open (again) until 5 pm, so there was a choice between Thai food (here) or Indian food across the street. Obviously, we picked Thai food.

The decoration of the place was nice. I thought it was interesting that my friend was stating that the decor reminded her of her grandparent's house because of the statues and whatnot. 

Anyway, the place was pretty empty when we came in. There as probably two other guest there besides us, whom btw showed why too much PDA inside a thai restaurant. However, we were too hungry to really care.

We both ended up getting the Lunch special, pretty sweet deal if you ask me. I got the Spicy Basil with Fried Tofu lunch special. My friend and I both thought the soup was way too salty and sour. My spicy basil wasn't really spicy, and that too was salty. However, the thai iced tea was good.

The service here was good nothing to complain about. The girl was friendly, attentive and quick. 

This place wouldn't come to mind when I think of Thai food, so I wouldn't come back unless my luck with sushi failed me again.
author: Tina T.

description: WINGS!!!! I am addicted to these wings.  on tuesday I ordered [delivery] one order [10 wings] of the wings.  They are topped with crispy basil, crispy skin to perfection, and sauced just enough.  So the following day, wednesday, I ordered two orders.  I ate all of them and i cant stop thinking about them. YUMMMMMMMMMMMM!
author: Mylea G.

description:
They deliver to my far out neck of the woods, which makes me happy.

We always order the same thing: chicken pad seew and ginger tofu - it's not overpriced, it's not greasy, & the flavor is good.  It's an awesome change to all the worse-than-mediocre chinese delivery places around  (n fact, if you read this, & you live in the hood, & know of a kickass chinese place that delivers, let me know. Also, if you know of a place that makes kickass american-style chinese, let me know, because sometimes that's just exactly what I want.)
author: Robyn C.

description:
We had the Papaya salad with prawns.  Very nice.  I'm a big fan of papaya salad and this one was pretty tasty. Then had an order of fresh rolls.  They were fine.  Large portions!
Finished with Three buddies Pad.  Another tasty dish.  Like this place a lot.
author: Scott K.

description:
I'm a big fan of Patpong.  I've actually never eaten at the restaurant but I've ordered delivery from there SEVERAL times.  They are always really quick too (about 30 minutes tops).
 
I get the yellow curry with chicken pretty much every time because I love it.  I get full easily so I always have leftovers for lunch.  The flavor in the curry I think is really good.

My boyfriend gets the spicy noodles with beef or the spicy basil duck and really likes it.

I wish they had corn cakes but an appetizer but I really enjoy their "Green onion pancakes." I put that in quotations because it's not your typical green onion pancakes. They're more light and flaky and I think it's super good! (Do not go into it think they're like normal green onion pancakes though).

I also really like the Thai Iced Tea but I've never had too many bad iced teas in general. 

I would definitely recommend ordering from here!
author: Anjali P.

description:
Patpong Thai Restaurant...What can I say? You clearly haven't grasped the concept of delivery and it shows. Last year, my office ordered Patpong for our holiday party. Patpong is conveniently located new our office in the outer Richmond, so we thought it was the perfect fit. Placing the order with the restaurant was quite simple, but actually getting our food was another story. We ordered about $300 worth of food for a party of 20 to be delivered at noon. Not a huge order, but substantial enough that I thought it would be given proper attention. I called in the morning to verify the order and the noon delivery time and was told everything would be delivered on time. Noon rolls by and no food. I wait another 15 minutes and no food, so I decide to call. The owner tells me that driver is out for delivery and should arrive any second and sorry for the delay. So we wait.....party begins at 12:30pm, but still no food. So I call the owner again, he explains the driver can't find the building....my response was, "Really? The driver can't find the main entrance to the VA hospital?" In response, I got a bunch of excuses. So I hang up and wait. Another 15 minutes rolls by and still no food. I call the owner again and ask him to call his driver. (At this time, I am beginning to become agitated). He says, "Oh I tried, but the driver dropped his phone in his car and can't find it." I respond that how could he possibly know this if he hasn't been able to reach him. Silence on the other end. I get a bunch more excuses and finally I say to him, "I am not hanging up until the food arrives." So we sit on the phone for 10 minutes in silence. Finally, I see the driver's car and have a fellow colleague run out and grab him. To my shock the driver steps out of the car in his pajamas with a cigarette hanging out of his mouth and a half-dressed girl in the front seat. The driver doesn't even offer to help bring the food into the building and just sets it on the trunk of his car and waits until we make multiple trips to bring it in. Sadly, he also delivered our curry in the pot it was cooked in, no plastic serving bowl that we were promised and paid for. 

I must say, Patpong is the worst delivery in San Francisco. Their blatant disregard for customers and ability to lie is deplorable. I will never order from Patpong again, nor would I recommend it to anyone who wants their food actually delivered. The food is average anyway, so you aren't really missing anything. Try Another Monkey in the Mission, if you want good quality Thai in San Francisco.
author: Alice S.

description: This is my go to place for thai!  I love the food and the thai iced tea.  You can't go wrong with their yellow curry.
author: Joanzie P.

description:
Must put in an excellent word for this gem of a Thai restaurant.  Food is outstanding, well priced and they have tremendous variety.  They can adjust spiciness to your liking and strive to please.  With deliver,y food always arrives hot.

Very impressive and worth a try!
author: Jerome B.

description: After figuring out that Patpong had merged with Samila and that the location was not on Geary, we decided to walk the extra distance to the Clement location. There was one couple eating when we arrived and they completed their meal before our dinner arrived. During our meal a couple folks arrived to get take-out. The staff was attentive and pleasant. The decor was pleasing. We ordered the vegetable Tom Ka soup, brown rice, Ginger Salmon and a noodle dish. The food was prepared and served quickly. The spices were interesting though not remarkable. The homemade noodles were tasty though cooked just a minute or two too long (the peanut sauce was tasty).  The portions were more than sufficient for the two of us making for a reasonably priced dinner out.  All in all an average Thai meal.
author: David O.

description: Patpong is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Their staff is super friendly, food is always fresh and when ordering delivery it comes within 20 minutes of ordering. I recently moved out of the city and cant wait to make a trip into the city just so I can eat here again. Chicken pad thai and chicken thai fried rice are so yummy!
author: Sharyce A.

description:
I've read a lot about Patpong's and could not wait to try it out.  I was disappointed with some of the dishes on my first visit.  I will rate this first visit 3 1/2 stars.  We have ordered these dishes...

*Garlic fried calamari - hmmm, not want I expected.  I didn't taste much garlic and thought this dish was a little bland and greasy.

**Pad Thai with chicken, thin rice noodles stir-fried with fried tofu, egg, bean sprouts and green onions with crushed peanuts on the side.  This is Pad Thai on the wet side, not dry fried as expected.

***Red curry beef, pumpkin, bell pepper, green bean served with rice, Served with cucumber salad topped with crushed peanuts on the side, and fish cake appetizer.  Tasty flavor

****Spicy, crispy fried chicken wings - Crispy chicken wings marinated with spicy Patpong sauce, topped with crispy basil.  Great flavor but is greasy when delivered to our table.  It would be nice if they could mop up the fresh grease after taking out of the oil.

The good: The Thai decor is a nice simple contemporary. 

The bad:  The deep fried dishes are greasy.  Maybe, a few minutes in the oven or mopping the grease with paper towels would do the trick.
author: Nanette L.

description:
Originally i wanted to go to Bai Som but it was closed so we continued further down the street and tried this Thai restaurant.  It was good, but I prefer Bai Som.
Small restaurant, cute, simply decorated, clean.
the person i was with doesn't like spicy, so we ordered non-spicy dishes.  They were a little bland.
Stuffed Chicken Wings - after ordering them, we were told they were out of them.   
Thai Style Fried Rice - good but fairly standard.
Crab Meat Pad Thai - good, but it seemed the crab was just put on top... not marinated and not a lot of flavor.
Basil Duck - meat was tender and cooked well, but really not much flavor.
Overall I'd say the dishes were good, but weren't very unique or flavorful.
author: Nedra D.

description:
My car broke down in San Francisco on Memorial Day, and my boyfriend and I were stranded. The one car shop that was open that day (Clement Street Auto Garage - I'm reviewing that next) was down the street, and we were looking to find some place to eat while the shop ran some diagnostics. Having stayed in the city for 3 nights, we still hadn't eaten any Thai cuisine, so we decided to eat at the tiniest Thai place we could find, something that looked family owned. We found Patpong Thai.

The decor is nice, the server was friendly, and the food came out pretty quickly.

The lunch specials are a great price! You get soup, a little salad, an appetizer, and your entree with rice for about $7-9.

I got the vegetable red curry with the fried wonton appetizer.
The soup was okay, but I've never had Thai soup, so I have nothing to compare it to. The fried wontons were pretty good, as was the dipping sauce. The peanut salad dressing was deliscious (though it cracks me up how the unhealthy dressing totally cancels out the very little nutrition that is in that type of "salad"). The red curry was very good (though I prefer it a little spicier; I guess I should have asked for green?), and the rice was the perfect texture.

My boyfriend got the chicken? pad thai. I don't like noodles/pasta in general, but I could have stolen a heck of a lot more bites from him, than I did. It was REEEALLLY good. Again, I didn't have any former experience of pad thai to compare it to, but I don't like noodles and these were fantastic! Perfect amount of cabbage and carrots and crunchy peanuts and all that good stuff. He seemed pretty pleased as well, but we were both exhausted from our trip and our 2 mile hilly trek from my car (not to the restaurant, but earlier in the day), so he didn't say too much. 

The exhaustion brought him to order a Thai iced coffee. He seemed quite pleased with that as well. I only had 2 sips because coffee puts my stomach in knots, but it tasted pretty good. I'm not a fan of sweet stuff, but it was creamy enough to counter the sugar. Again, I had no prior experience with Thai iced coffee with which to compare it.

All in all, Patpong didn't completely blow my mind, but it was good enough to take my mind off the fact that my car was broken and we were stranded for who knows how long with nowhere to stay in a still unfamiliar city.....

This is one of a bagillion reviews that I'm posting from my San Francisco Birthday 2010 trip. Check 'em out!
author: Kate C.

description:
I have been to Patpong for lunch many times, and find the food consistent, flavorful, and the portions generous.  It is my favorite Thai I have tried within SF, and I have probably tried about a dozen others.  
I strongly suggest the pad kee moa, pumpkin curry, and veggie spring rolls.  I think what sets them apart from the other Thai restaurants is the quality and freshness of the ingredients.  She food is always served piping hot because the servers are attentive.    
The lunch combinations are an incredible bargain.  My only suggestions for them would be to update the wine menu.
author: Carla K.

description:
I stopped in for lunch, and the menu was very small.  I was hoping for a bigger selection.  I went with the lunch combo- 1 appetizer, one entree, and soup and salad for $7.95.  Sounds like a great deal, but needless to say everything was tiny.  The food was just no good.  It wasn't horribly offensive, but I probably could have made it better.
