What really turned me off though, was the server.  He was wearing converse, which he wore more like clogs so he could slip his feet in and out in a hurry I suppose.  He scuffed and dragged his feet all around the dining room.  He also wore his hair in a dramatic bob, which was constantly in his face.  There were too many little service problems for me to list them all, but the icing on the cake was when he put the check down, went to drop off another check, and then came back immediately to pick up the check.  I was still eating!  I just looked at him and said I wasn't done yet, and he scuffed off.

With Bai Som a few blocks away, I won't be back.
author: Theresa H.

description:
The smell when you first walk into this place is very pungent.  Smells like sewer water.  Can't figure out what it is neither.  hmmmmm????  I came here a few times prior and wanted to order enough food so that I can give an accurate assessment of this restaurant.

The staff is very friendly.

Garlic Rice with Chicken (this dish really stands out)
spicy basil tofu
pad thai
curry duck 
minced pork with basil

All very mediocre.  You can probably get better food at Chabaa, Marnee Thai(although I boycotted them), Osha thai on Geary, or Thai Spice.

Price is average for thai food.
author: jason g.

description:
Love this place. When I first rolled in, I was a bit skeptical because the exterior was so so. But the interior is surprisingly clean and nice.

Everything I've had there has been good at a very good price. The duck, the noodles, and anything else I can remember has been good.

Normally I'd give 4 stars, but they do have good prices, so I think it warrants a fifth star.
author: Al L.

description: Me and my buddy were walking down Clement and their widow menu caught our eye. Very reasonable price for their luncheon specials. So we went in and wre greeted by a friendly young lady with a beautiful smile. I ordered the red chicken curry and chicken satay(2) for my special. It was really tasty with good size portions. I will definatly be going back. My buddy will be writing his own review.
author: Tom C.

description:
Great food
Great price
Ungodly wicked fast delivery
I am a believer
author: matt l.

description:
Phucket.

Me, " How do you say it?"

my #1 son, " Just FXXX'n' say it dad, I know what you thinking."

Me, " No, no, not that, I know that. but really, how?"

my #2 son, "Phuck it dad, just phuck it," 

my #1 son, "shut it, waitress is coming."

Waitress,"Have you decide?"

So, we ordered:
Green onion pan cakes.
Papaya salad.
veggie green curry, we ordered extra spicy! 
spicy basil tofu.
vege noodle,
2-garlic rice.
1-brown rice.

my both sons loved the Young Coconut juice.
Ugh!
I didn't like the juice!
But everything else was really GOOD!
Spicy Good!
The waitress was really nice.
The bathroom was a bit skanky, I looked for a light but the sign says out side that inside of the door after I found the switch out side.

my #2 son, " So, hows your Phucket?"

me, " Oh, this shit is pretty good. I like it."

my #2 son, " Phuckin A,"

It's a thai beer. I like Shingha too but I couldn't help try the PHUCKET.
author: Nobu K.

description: Food was fresh and tasty.  Nice cozy atmosphere.  Friendly service.  Really inexpensive for the quality!!  I would return again.
author: Forest H.

description:
They only gave me half a carton of the Tom Gah Kai (better known as chicken-coconut-mushroom soup-crack which fuels my life.)  HALF a carton.

: /

It was delicious and it made me sad that there was not more of it.
author: Kate R.

description:
Came here for dinner one night and it instantly became a favorite.  Service is usually fast and always friendly.

Pad Kee Mao (spicy noodles):
Amazing.  Spicy enough to make your nose water yet not spicy enough to where you can no longer taste the food.  They use green beans, tomatoes, and bell peppers as the vegatables along with the spicy basil leaves and your choices of chicken,pork,beef.

Honey Roasted Duck:
The duck is almost tender.  It is the best duck I have ever had.  The sauce they put on it is sweet and compliments the duck well.

Their fried banana dessert is something you must try if you have never had it before.  The fried banana part is longer than at most Thai restaurants, it looks like they took a banana and cut it in half and then fried it, instead of being in small fried balls.  The batter they use is light.  The two pieces of banana are served with a scoop of coconut ice cream.  When it comes out they draw a happy face on the ice cream.

The best Thai I have ever had in the city.
author: Brooke R.

description:
Wow, lots of unhappy customers, but I have had nothing but good food and service the two times I have been to Patpong.  I might not travel across town for it, but I have sampled eight or ten things on the menu and would eat any of them again.

This place is special because it is quiet.  There isn't anything else special come to think of it, but I definitely would be happy to eat there again.  Great appetizers and a very accommodating staff.
author: Quinn S.

description: Been to this place many times for quick lunch. Big fan of green curry. Fresh ingredients and good quality. This is my local favorite Thai food place
author: Dhiren P.

description:
I have been a customer of Patpong for quite some time.  Recently, I took a former employee of mine here for lunch.  We had the Fried Tofu and Chicken Satay as appetizers and the Chicken Spicy Basil and the Chicken Green Curry as entrees.  For their lunch specials,  you get an appetizer, entree, soup, salad and rice.  We each liked our meals and the price was right.

For dinner, some of my favorite appetizers are Chicken or Beef Satay, the Fish Cakes, and the Fried Tofu.  My favorite soup is Tom Khar Gai (coconut soup with chicken).  For the entrees, my favorites are veggie Pad Thai, Spicy Basil Chicken and the Panang Curry.

I have a soft spot for their Panang Curry.  I have tried that dish at half a dozen different Thai restaurants and Patpong always does it the best.  I consider myself a meat eater, but I will order the Panang Curry vegetarian as a good change of pace for my palate.  It is a great treat.

I am a big fan of Patpong.  I have seen some of the reviews on the chairs being uncomfortable.  Unfortunately, I have to join the other Yelpers in this regard.  The chairs were there from the previous restaurant before Patpong took over the space.  But overall, Patpong is great food nonetheless!
author: Janet H.

description:
EDIT 01/16/08:  I've been here a couple times in the past month after having not been here for nearly two years.  I knocked them down a star (to four), because I've been to soooo many more Thai places to know that they probably aren't five star worthy.  BUT, they're still good and reliable--a place I can count on when I crave that fried deliciousness that are sweet potatoes.  

--------------

There's seriously at least one Thai restaurant on every block on Clement; if one's closed, another's sure to be open just down the street.  What's nice about Patpong is that they're open from morning to night--none of these lil siesta type deals where they have to close between lunch and dinner.  If I roll out of bed at 3 p.m., I wanna know that I can get some decent Thai food in my stomach by 4 p.m.  The food is very good.  (Try the fried sweet potatoes.)  The portions are generous, and the waitstaff was attentive.  My only complaint is that if they continue to play boy-band music over the speakers while patrons are eating, I'm going to have all of the food that went into my stomach out by 5 p.m.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
the food is pretty good here, decent sized portions, but the service isn't very attentive- the beer comes after the food, appetizers served with the main course, not before.
The noodle dishes are really good, soups great, salads would be better if they didn't use plain iceberg lettuce.
Overall, good, decent Thai at a fair price, with bigger portions than bai som down the street.
author: Ali M.

description:
I've driven by this place a few times and have been meaning to try it for a while.   The dreary day out today made me want the yummy goodness that is my comfort food aka Thai.  Ben got the yellow curry, extra spicy with chicken and I stuck with old faithful, the pad see ew with shrimp.  The curry apparently was seasoned with dried chili flakes rather than chili oil, which was different but good.  It was almost like the aroma of the sauce was where you picked up the spiciness, so that when you inhaled you tasted the spicy, rather than instantly when you put the food on your tongue.  The sauce on the pad see ew was really, really rich, sweet and kind of syrup-y.  Ben really liked it, said it's probably his favorite pad see ew of all the Thai places we've tried.  I liked it, but I'm not running out the door to print a t-shirt telling the world how great it was.  Portions were perfect, not huge but not too small either.  

This place is pretty small inside and unfortunately due to the fact that it has wood floors, wood on the walls and basically seems like it's trying to break some record for acoustics inside a restaurant, we had to listen to the girls across the room talk about their myspace drama.  Oh dear, the world will surely end if Johnny doesn't friend request Suzie.  Other than that the decor was nice, there was soft music playing the background and it had a generally calm, relaxed feel.  Service was good, although like with many other Thai places I've been to, my food and his rice came out about 3-5 minutes before his curry came out.  Awkward.

With rice to go with the curry it came to $17.  I say it goes on the Good for 2 under $20 list.
author: Courtney N.

description:
Ok, I might be a little biased here because I live above Patpong... but I'm going to post this anyway.

Service: SUPER friendly. If your take out order is not ready, they will seat you and bring you fresh tea as you wait.
Price: Eh, a little over priced, but it's a quality place, so I can't complain.
Food: Yum! Opt for the yellow coconut curry and rice. HOLY MOLY it's so delicious. OH! And the Thai tea is delicious too!
Location: Smack dab in the nicer part of the Clement.
author: Amy B.

description:
I've converted...to the altar of curry! I was never a big fan of curry...must be cause when I've eaten homemade curry before and I'm always left with yellow greasy teeth.

Linda L. and I ordered the usual Pineapple fried rice and the green curry seafood combination vegetable dish. Usually when I get the fried rice, it's usually served in a pineapple half bowl. But I was surprised with the square plating. The fried rice was all right, but mix in with the green curry sauce, was the bomb! Curry with pineapples and raisins...who'd have thunk it.  I could have licked from the curry bowl...except I was in public (sigh). Both servings were appropriately sized, not too much to feel obese, but not to skimpy to feel like I was ripped off.

Service was brisk and our lime water was always filled.  Nice decor, pretty candles, the chairs looked like they belonged in a school auditorium...but overall, I had a good experience.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Despite what others are saying, I always thought Patpong's prices were pretty reasonable, ney, cheap. While the restaurant is small, it is very nice inside and the food is always very good. 

It's definitely an all-around better dining experience for about the same price as you would pay at the King of Thai up the street.
author: Justin B.

description: A little, unassuming place, but my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco.  Always great food and friendly staff.  I could eat there every day.
author: Timmy H.

description:
I miss you Patpong! I used to live one block away and would order delivery about once every 2 weeks. 

I love their crispy shrimp rolls. I always ask for extra sauce and then pour it on my pad thai. yummmm. 

My usual order:
Chicken Pad Thai
Crispy Shrimp Rolls with extra sauce
Chicken Pad See Ewe (YUM!)
Green Curry

I've eaten at the restaurant a few times and always had a quiet, pleasurable time. Sometimes I even picked food up here! Talk about not being lazy! :P

Delivery is pretty fast (maybe cause I lived really close) and you can pay with credit card for delivery and add the tip when they come. I like that. I rarely carry cash, so this was always convenient.
author: Ali R.

description:
Actually, I wanna give them 3.5 stars.  Came here for lunch with my boyfriend.  I'm supposed to be a vegetarian for the next couple of weeks so I figured Thai food would be nice.  Being super loving, my boyfriend agreed to let me do the ordering so we got the lunch combo with Veggie Red Curry and Veggie Egg Rolls (came with soup, salad and rice) and a Pad Kee Mao with Tofu.  I was kind of upset that they didn't bother to tell us that the soup was cooked with chicken broth even though we ordered everything vegetarian...%#*&@!!!  Anyway, the red curry was mediocre and didn't have many veggies in there...just lots of tofu.  Loved the pad kee mao though.

I've eaten here/ordered take-out about a dozen times from here before and I like that I can always count on them to make a nice and spicy pad kee mao.  Their portions are kind of small but I'm okay with it because Thai food is so fattening anyway.  Overall pretty good Thai food.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Delicious food. Their green curry is to die for.
FANTASTIC service!
You absolutely need to order the young coconut juice at the end of your meal... I plan on going there at least once a week for it!
author: Chelsea H.

description:
When my favorite Thai delivery joint closed, I almost cried - and then the delivery guy consoled me and whispered, "Here's where I'll be working," as he slipped me a new menu. I've been hooked ever since.

All the usual haunts like delicious, mild yellow chicken curry are on the menu - as well as some unexpected (at least to me) delights like cashew nut chicken (unique taste unlike your standard Chinese variety). I'm always pleased by their prompt delivery (every time they tell me 45 minutes, it's more like 25 or 30) and really nice service - and it's hard to exhibit stand-out service in delivery.

Maybe one day I'll actually go into the restaurant - but for now, I'm just loving my drive-up dinner.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
I've been meaning to do this for a while. I haven't been back to Patpong in many months. I don't know if they changed ownership or what, but I feel seriously betrayed. The last two times I went here were bad.  I'm sorry Patpong. I used to love you, but I can't in good conscience  leave you with that 5-star rating.

Both times there was a huge table full of people with uncontrolled, unruly kids running around making a lot of noise and playing with toys all over the floor. I guess they are the family and friends of the owners because they seem to always be there.  I don't have a problem with kids being kids, but the screaming... it's a bit too much.

There was a new waiter there who is not good.  All the times I'd gone before, I was served by a very courteous and kind waitress.  This guy is crap in comparison. Like I said, it's been months since I went back because of this guy, so I actually have no idea if he still works there. Hopefully he's been fired so I can give Patpong back one star.

This was when I decided I would not be coming back. I ordered the Pad See Ewe with beef.  It arrived with chicken. Okay, no big deal. I decided to just eat it instead of make a complaint.  Then, when I was about halfway through the dish, I feel...something in my mouth.  I spit it out and it is a piece of eggshell. Gross!  I forked through the dish some more and discovered another HUGE cracked up piece of eggshell. It was like 1/4 of the shell, and I wonder how the hell someone could miss this?

So I called this bumbling waiter over and pointed it out to him, and all the while I'm talking he has this huge grin on his face. WTF!  You're supposed to be apologetic and nod sympathetically, not grin at me! 

To be fair, shortly after he took the dish away, one of the female waitresses stopped by our table to say they were very sorry. I got a replacement meal to-go. This time it had beef and no eggshells.  They may still be a decent carry out choice, but I wouldn't eat in again until they get rid of that waiter and the crazy kid family.
author: Megan Y.

description:
We had the pad thai, pad see ew, larb, and red curry. The food was OK. I really liked the larb and pad see ew especially. The pad thai was very average. However, something happened that took away one star for me.

We ordered for delivery, and it came about an hour later as promised. The total amount was 28.40, so we decided to give $34 even, which is a fairly decent tip if I do say so myself. :P The kid who delivered the food didn't even count the money and left. Two hours later, we received an angry phone call from him! I can't believe he had the audacity to do that!!! He claimed we didn't give him any tip!! We reminded him that we gave him $34 for a $28.40 meal, and he apologized and quickly hung up. I am tempted to call back and ask for my tip back, because I didn't give a generous tip to be yelled at...

Anyway, don't take deliveries from this place. Grr.
author: Bekki J.

description:
I'm Thai, I understand Thai but I didn't speak any Thai while ordering here. I was born and raised in the United States. So I didn't have a Thai accent when ordering either. We were the only guests in the restaurant around 5pm. There was a little kid that belong to one of the workers on his heelies and falling ever so often saying SHIT. Keep in mind this is a little kid, about 7-8 years old saying SHIT every 2 minutes.

The food came, I'd have to say it's okay. I guess being Thai, all this stuff I can get from my mother. But nothing really astounded my taste buds. 

What irked me the most was the SERVICE!!! We had to come across one of the bitchest servers there. On the menu it says Desserts "special daily" and nothing else, therefore you assume to ask the wait/ress So I asked the male waiter when he came by. He said he had to ask the other waitress (bitch). Now their conversation happens in Thai. He askes, he comes back and tells us. We didn't feel like eating Fried Banana and Ice Cream and he goes back to get our check. She says with a Thai valley girl accent (yes, it's possible) "Do they want it?!" he says "No, they didn't feel like it."  Then she gives more attitude to it and says "REALLY!?" We sat about 10 ft away so I could hear everything. Like it was rude of us, to ask what the daily dessert was and not to wanting to get it. 

I only came here cause I got 4% back cause of Upromise. But considering the service I won't go back.

Maybe it's just me, but if you don't understand any Thai, go ahead. But Now you'll assume their going to be talking crap about you. ^_^
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Really good thai. dont get the wantons. the egg roles are good though.

I love curry and I got the panang curry. it was great and was actually spicy which is rare.
author: Will U.

description:
Great Thai food delivery.

Food tastes fresh and clean.
author: Veronica H.

description:
We were seeking an inexpensive lunch in the neighborhood and ran across Patpong's lunch special. Soup, an appetizer and a rice plate for $7.95. A great value!

The space itself is pleasant - not a warm and cozy spot, but fairly attractive, with bare floors and granite tables. It took me a minute or two to warm up. 

The waitress brought us a bowl of tangy hot broth with a nice balance of sweet and hot. For my appetizer, I ordered the spring rolls and my girlfriend ordered the chicken satay. Both were excellent - the chicken had some serious love applied to it prior to grilling and the satay sauce was the right combination of sweet peanutiness.

The cool environment propelled me towards a curry. I had the chicken green curry, which was rich and spicy. The bowl had generous amounts of chicken (breast meat) and veggies.  My girlfriend ordered the red curry with pork. Both curries were well done with a satisfying amount of spice and flavor.

Upon leaving, we were ecstatic to see that not only was the food great, but they deliver locally, too! 

I'm looking forward to trying some of their other dishes, if I can tear myself away from the curry section of the menu. I'm a big fan of the Thai House (Express) in the Castro and this is definitely of that caliber.
author: Libby S.

description:
came in on a weekday. at like 3:30. We are the only table.There is just two of us.

 The Menu has so much, it took us surprising amount of time to choose. We finally did, Our Waitress was very nice but our food came out at different times. I dont mean like a few minutes. It was close to 10 minutes apart. 

did i mention there is just 2 of us in the restaurant? Although that kinda bothered me at the time. I must say the wait was worth it because I thought the food was extremly good. Very spicy. Which made it even better (for me) 

I would give it 5 stars for the food.
but the enviroment was just so awkward, and silent and the staff stared at us while we ate ( because we were the only ones in there)

I will order "to go" next time.
author: Joy I.

description:
this is my favorite thai place!
the thai tea here is the best i have ever had!
the green curry with chicken is good, even though it had coconut milk in it, its not overpowering like other places.
the spicy crispy chicken wings are so good, i tihnk they are better than san tungs wings. 
the green onion pancakes are also good, as well as the calamari.

and this place isnt too pricy, so its affordable to come!
author: Stella J.

description:
EDIT: 8/29/07

Knockin' one star off because I got the pad woon sen yesterday and there were no veggies in my noodles whatsoever (besides green onion and regular onion).  I love picking at the carrots and napa cabbage!  It tasted good but without the veggies and the semi smaller portion I'm not as impressed...
______________________________________________________
The Pad Woon Sen (Silver Noodles with Veggies+Meat) is pretty frickin' awesome here!  I haven't dined in before, but the times I got it to-go were quick and easy.  Prices are fairly reasonable.  The people here are friendly and nice.  

Located around 25th and Clement... so pick an order up and head to either Baker or Ocean Beach to eat tummy Thai food and enjoy a spectacular view! =D
author: Michelle W.

description:
Hey, there are some days when you just want to put the uglies on and have food delivered.  This place is great - I get delivery in half and hour and their chicken larb is yum.  Don't ask them to make it spicy because it is crazy spicy; as in local eaterie in Thailand spicy...  or have I just become a woss (sp?).

Anyway, give it a go - I have not been disappointed.
author: Mei B.

description:
I love this place!  They have the nicest servers and a great atmosphere.  The restaurant is kept clean and has a calming ambiance.  Their apps are fantastic - try the fresh rolls or the fried spring rolls.  For dinner, their garlic chicken is awesome, as well as the green curry and the ginger beef or chicken.

Delivery is typically around 30-45 minutes and comes still piping hot and intact (don't you hate it when delivery food slops all over the container?)

Try this place and you won't be disappointed.
author: Jennifer U.

description: This place is great for dining in and they deliver takeout orders as well! The pad see ew with beef is delicious, lots of flavor! Their green curry and panang curry are spicy and flavorful, and everything is generously portioned! The prices are also great, with entrees under $10! Definitely will be a regular.
author: Carolyn G.

description:
I was disappointed in the food we ordered to go.  
We were totally misled by the reviews!  A warning to take reviews with a grain of salt. It wasn't that good at all. 
We ordered the papaya salad, Duck Basil and some peanut sauce chicken dish.  The papaya salad at King of Thai is actually better.  This papaya salad was a bit bland and waaay too expensive for the quality that was put out.  They must make SO much money because the ingredients aren't that great!
The Duck basil was mostly fat.  I understand that roast duck is fatty but we only scavenged about 4-5 small slices of meat from the whole $9 dish!  The chicken dish was worse yet.  It was just boiled veggie and boiled pieces of chicken...with a super sweet and chunky peanut sauce over it.  The sauce could totally be for dessert! It was THAT sweet.  Makes me wonder, maybe the chef mistaken sugar for salt.  
Overall, it was totally overrated and not good enough.  Places like these, make me not like Thai food all that much.
author: Tu L.

description: I've been going to this place for lunch for over a year now.  With the recession and all, a lunch set is @7.95 for soup, salad, choice of appetizer and entree.  Not dirt cheap, but you definitely get what you pay for -- good prep and fresh ingredients. What I particularly like is being able to order the fishcakes as a lunch set appetizer.  At other places, I'd have to place a whole order which is too much when dining solo. I've tried the curries and they're good as well.
author: Bodhi D.

description: How in the world does this place survive, and on Clement Street no less?  Mediocre food, took forever (35 minutes for food for 4, and there was 1 other table in the restaurant the entire time), and it was freezing in the dining room.  $9 for 2 of the most suspect looking cups of Tom Kha Gai that I've ever seen?  The Pad Thai was watery and devoid of anything that implied quality.  Ugh.  Avoid till they seriously review their recipes and ingredient selection.
author: Rob P.

description:
I had been here a few times and the food wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. I was mostly dropping cash here because I earn united miles and sometimes I'm a lazy ass and don't want to trek all the way down to Bai Som or up the street to the no longer there King of Thai. That was until they served me the most heinous tofu pad see ew ever created on the planet. Pad see ew happens to be one of my favorite things to eat and I don't think I've ever put something in my mouth that was this awful. Rancid tofu and funky veggies are not a good combo!

It's not a destination spot, there isn't anything really special about it but if you're really lazy it isn't that bad. Just don't order the pad see ew with tofu.
author: Lauren D.

description:
There's nothing in the world worse than overpaying for bad food. Not even mediocre food, just bad. 

We used to order from here a lot because my boyfriend likes the seafood curry dish even though I always thought the pad thai (my litmus test for Thai places) was just OK and skimpy on the shrimp. This time, though, when we ordered we realized that they raised their prices. 

You would think that the portion sizes would at least stay the same. The pad see ewe was so skimpy I am still hungry!! I used to get at least 2 meals out of the pad thai and pad see ewe dishes, but now I'm still hugry after eating the whole thing. To ice the cake, it wasn't even good! Pad see ewe should be sweet, this was just salty. And the beef was so grissly I had to spit it out. 

To top it all off, the thai tea that my boyfriend ordered arrived on its side, leaking all over the bag it was wrapped in. And no straw. 

When I called them to tell them that I was dissapointed in their shrinking portions, the chick on the phone almost seemed bored. All she could say was, "sorry about that". Gee, thanks (for nothing!).

After travelling through Thailand I am familiar with good and not so good Thai food. There are lots of great Thai places in the city, and with the choices being almost unlimited, I will never order food from here again.
author: Amy B.

description:
I recommend starting with the mini crab cakes appetizer.  Unless I am there and they only have enough for one order left.  Then you will let me have them.  I'm not kidding.  Being a mini-chick, I already have a high appreciation for all things mini, but these really are amazing.  Perfectly seasoned, nearly bite-sized and accompanied by a refreshing cucumber salad.  The sweet potato app and the samosas are also pretty good, but not at the same level and can slightly suffer the fate of mush if you get them "to go".

My favorite dish here is the prawns with ginger chili paste.  It's weird because I have had this same dish at other restaurants and enjoyed it but it is prepared differently here and it really stands out.  Something about the the sweet/spicy combo that is just right.  

What's especially nice about this place is that the ambiance is really quiet, softly lit with candles and gently scented by the jasmine oil that is heated in the back of the restaurant.  Even when it is crowded, the noise level is low which makes for a nice, casual, neighborhood restaurant date vibe.  Even the servers are attentive, but quiet and non-intrusive.  In other words, they are there when you need them but don't hover.  

Street parking can be challenging, but there is a lot just down the street if you get frustrated.  I usually end up circling 2-3 times and finding a spot without a problem.
author: Trina C.

description: The food was delicious.  I had vegetables in red curry, and my friend had spicy salmon.  We were both very happy with our choices.  Staff was friendly, atmosphere was nice.  The only thing that was not good was that they brought my entree first and we had to wait for his.
author: sophia I.

description: Great lunch! The pumpkin curry & spicy Thai basil entrees were about as good as I've ever had. The soup & salad included in the lunch specials were pretty good, and the veggie eggrolls outstanding. Fish cakes a bit bland. Based on the entrees alone, I'd give it 5 stars. A bargain at $7.95 a person!
author: J R.

description:
Here's how this night went - 
We were starving and decided to make an adventure out of the evening and find a place on Yelp to try. The place we chose.......CLOSED by the liqueur control board! DAMN!! 
So we start walking down the street to window shop for a new place and we come across this cute little Thai place and I grab my Iphone to check out the Yelp review - IT'S GOOD!  We decide to give it a go.
First of all, the chairs did NOT look comfortable, but they were. The Prices were PERFECT. And we both dive right into the menu - there were a TON of choices. We order 2 Singha while we read the menu thoroughly. The beer come out with two chilled mugs - EXTRA POINTS there!
First course - an order of fried spring rolls and some crispy chicken wontons. The plate presentation was beautiful and the taste was delish. A perfect portion for each of us and enough of the sweet sauce to coat it all in. This place was surely a 5 star Yelp in my book. 
Here's where it all went wrong - 
I get up to use the restroom and wash my hands of the sticky appetizer sauce. The bathroom was DISGUSTING!! Only one toilet for the whole place (that's fine) and it looked like a hobo threw up in there. Cleaning supplies strewn all over the floor (USE THEM!, don't just display them) and its cramped and dirty. Then I notice there is no toilet paper and no new rolls laying in this filth to replace it. 
As I stand there washing my hands, I am literally thinking of how I hope my date doesn't have to use the bathroom and I really hope I can just forget about this bathroom and still give the place 5 stars!
It only gets worse - 
Our entrees arrive while I'm in the bog of eternal stench.....I casually walk back to the table as if there was nothing to see there. 
We have Phad Thai, Some Rice, and an order of Sweet and Sour Chicken (don't even ask why we decide to try this) - And the Phad Thai is generic, your basic Phad Thai. I take a bite and CRUNCH! I must have bit into a rock or some sand or something. I mean, I felt like I had a mouth FULL of ground up teeth! Really weird. I am thinking that it was some dirt from the green onions or something. Nothing I can't handle - but lets make a note that this was a lot of flipping sand, ok? Then The Sweet and Sour Chicken gets there. This junk was like a giant bowl of orange ectoplasm with some fried chicken and veggies floating around in it. It was SUPER SWEET. there isn't enough rice in the WORLD to sop up all this soup. I wouldn't be able to even pick out the pieces I wanted cause it was all COVERED in slimy, sweet goop. This dish was inedible. 
Then my nightmare continues as my date gets up to use the restroom. Oh No......

As a side note, the service was great.
author: Jena D.

description:
I kicked and screamed when my room mate demanded that I try Patpong for delivery. Had I known they were on Clement and 25th I would have totally nixed the idea since we live in Hayes Valley . All I can say is 5 STARS! If there were 1O I would give them 1O STARS 

Prompt delivery and the delivery kid - so gracious - so kind ! My friends think he is very cute= if that matters. 

Talk about fresh ... F R E S H !!!! The garlic black pepper beef- wowsa - the flavors and seasoning were perfect -the meat was excellent - the sauce.. slurp - with just a tiny dash of mint -- VERY GOOD. The green and yellow chicken curies - again done perfectly - not to blah not too spicy - just right - spot on. The chicken plump and juicy. 
Unlike most Thai and Asian places - they don't freeze and then shave their meats. 
Every vegetable in every dish was fresh, ;and perfectly ripe for that dish. 
The brown rice - be sure to order extra - these folks know how to do rice - not over cooked or made hours before... hot - PLUMP and so good. 

I am one hard kat to please too! 

If you truly love and appreciate Thai food - the flavors - the complexity - the elegance - PATPONG KICKS ASS!!! 1O STARS
author: miguel p.

description:
Update #3  2-10-07

I finally managed to make it in for a sit down dinner.  The food was delicious and came out quick.  The service was friendly.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Update #2  11-1-06

I have yet to find a better Thai place so I gave Patpong another chance.  I still haven't dined in the restaurant but the take out service was quick and easy.  Maybe they were having an off day last time.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My once favorite Thai restaurant now  leaves a bad taste in my mouth.  I worked in the restaurant industry for 5 years.  I know how important good service and customer service is ... if there is a problem or error ... it should be remedied IMMEDIATELY.  

My friend and I phoned in an order for pick up.  First of all, we were told it'd be ready in 20 minutes ... we gave them 25-30 and it wasn't quite ready.  When we got home, our appetizer was missing.   We called right away, they acknowledged that the appetizer had been left out.  They apologized and said they would deliver it.  I live 4 1/2 blocks away.  40 minutes later, we were still waiting for our appetizer.  

By this time we had already eaten the rest of our food.  I called to inquire about the missing dish and I was told it was on it's way now.  It arrived 10 minutes later ... soggy and cold.  (It was a deep fried appetizer ... like tempura ... something that doesn't taste right cold or warmed in the microwave).  

I called back and let them know the dish was soggy and cold and that nearly an hour had passed since I was told it would be delivered.  I was told repeatedly that, "the restaurant is so busy, very busy."  I pointed out that just because we weren't eating in the restaurant doesn't mean we shouldn't get good service ... it was their error ... we had already paid for the dish ... and the fact that I live soooooo close.  

We no longer wanted the appetizer and asked for our money back.  After several minutes of discussion (I was passed around to 4 different people on the phone and had to reexplain the situation to each of them), I was finally told I could have my money back but they wanted the appetizer back.  

45 minutes passed and no one had come to pick up the dish or bring us our money.  I called AGAIN.  I was told I had to wait 20 more minutes ... until the restaurant closed.  I told them we didn't want to wait 20 more minutes, we'd already been waiting 45 minutes for our money and another hour prior to that for our food.  

I pointed out how ridiculous it was ... especially since I was only a few blocks away and it was their error in the first place.  I told them we couldn't wait any longer ... that we had plans to go out.  Then the woman had the nerve to tell me I should have told her sooner that I had plans to go out ... had she known I wanted to go out, she would've had the delivery guy come back right away.  I seriously doubt that.

In the end, we had to go pick up the money and return the food on our way out.  When we arrived the staff didn't say a word to us, just handed over the money.  The woman I spoke with on the phone stared at me with a mad look on her face.  

Looks like I'm on the lookout for a new Thai restaurant.  

2-24-06

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  

I've never had a bad dish at Patpong.  The food is delicious and looks and tastes extremely fresh all the time.  I'm only giving 4 stars because I have yet to dine in the restaurant and experience the service, but I give them 5 stars on their free and fast delivery.  I eat Thai food about twice a week and this is the best place I've found in the city so far.  I highly recommend the garlic pepper pork or prawn dish and the Fresh rolls.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description:
We have Entertainment coupon book and we were going to give Greco-Romana a try but unfortunately that place was closed (due to fire), therefore we went to Patpong instead.
We ordered soft shelled crab ($10.95) and salmon ($9.95).
Both had good flavor although the salmon came out a bit overcooked.
The service was really good here. The waitress never forgot to fill up the water and always smiled.
Oh, rice was free for lunch. The rice smelled good - I think it was jasmine rice.
The bathroom was clean but needed more lighting.

Note:
As a comparison to the famous Marnee Thai on Irving St., they have slightly better and more authentic food although they were stingy on the portion of the food that we ordered (fish in banana leaf). They stuffed cooked cabbage and other veggies under the fish so that it looked plumped!
author: Oribel ..

description:
I've been here 2 handful of times over the course of a year and I really can't find anything bad to say.

I think the location is very easy to find and parking isn't like finding a needle in a haystack.
The prices are very economical for UBER TASTY Thai food.
The menu is abundant and even though I haven't tried every single thing on the menu, I do feel confident that they are all good, or at least decent.
The decor is modern yet warm and unpretentious; this is a local low-key eatery meant to be enjoyed with good company.
The servers are pleasant, patient, and courteous which makes the dining experience much more relaxing.

It appears that most reviewers have complained about the portions being small, well I scream to differ.
My boyfriend and I went just 2 weeks ago and we split Thai toast appetizer, honey roasted duck and thai basil pork w/ eggplant entrees and we each had individual rice bowl and that was much more than ENOUGH! I drank water and my boyfriend had a beer. There wasn't anything fancy or extra, we went straight to the point.
I really find it hard to believe that you can't be full from sharing some entrees and rice. You gotta be really greedy and regularly eat huge portions like a gaping pig to complain about the amount of food served! Good food is meant to be savored and enjoyed slowly NOT have mass quantities shoved down your throat!
You all need to take a lesson from Remy, a fictional rat-chef living in Paris- he obviously knows more about food than most humans! Go out and rent Ratatouille!!

Ok, so I did find a bad thing to say but it's about the people who bad mouthed this place!
author: K K.

description:
My co-workers decided to order take-out for lunch today and treated St. Gladys since it was her birthday week.  Patpong will deliver for free with a minimum order of $15 and they accept credit cards with a minimum $10 charge, no checks.   I tried the mild Gang Keo Warn Gai, $8.50, (Green curry with chicken, eggplant, bell peppers, zucchini, green beans and basil).  By my estimate, there was a good amt of chicken but not enough vegts.  The rice ($1) was ala carte.  The flavor was good, not fantastic.  
St. Gladys ordered the Prawns with Chili-Ginger Paste (Pad Prik King) $9.95.  I tried one of her mushrooms which was tasty but she said she wouldn't order it again.  The other co-worker ordered the Garlic pepper Beef ($7.95) and indicated that she really liked her dish.   There are 4 selections of rice with steamed at $1, and garlic rice, sticky rice and brown rice for $2/order.  
Other items on the menu include appetizers, salad, soups, fried rice, stir-fried noodles, curries, pork/beef dishes, chicken/duck dishes, seafood dishes and vegetarian/vegt stir-fried noodles.  I'd consider re-trying the food again even if it's not the best Thai food I've ever had, it' certainly wasn't the worse.
author: Ry T.

description:
Yum yum yum.  Husband, 2 kids and I randomly stopped here for dinner the other night.  When we first arrived, the place was empty (not a good sign), but it smelled so good, the prices were great, and we were starved, so we stayed.  Glad we did!

+ nice, simple, classy decor; comfortable
+ spicy basil chicken was SOOOO good
+ ditto green curry
+ service was extremely attentive - but, you know, we were practically alone... others did arrive later.

+/- pad thai was your basic pad thai.  my daughter liked it.
- papaya salad was okay but not terribly authentic. I like the little shrimp. there were no little shrimp :(

Overall, we were happy to have found the place and would definitely go there again the next time we're in SF and craving Thai...
author: Deborah K.

description: The food is pretty basic but good.  The service is terrible.  I've ordered from here twice.  The first time they were late I chalked it up to a bad night.  Ordered from here again and this time they took 1.5 hours to deliver our dinner.  I called to express my displeasure and kindly told the person that I wouldn't be ordering from them any longer... his response, "that's ok"  really??  I told him I was going to post that on Yelp, his response... hung up on me...
author: Geoff H.

description:
I ordered papaya salad, asked to make it spicy, received very mild. 

The spicy basil chicken and red curry had enough spice to make up for the bland papaya salad. It would be nice if they served it with rice instead of having to order them as sides. 

Overall, good. I would go back. Not sure I would order the papaya salad again.
author: Cassandra T.

description: We ordered Pad-See-Ew and Thai Fried Rice for take-out. From the looks of it, the restaurant itself looked classy and elegant. I wouldn't mind eating inside in the future. The staff was courteous and brought over some tea for us to drink while we waited. The food was pretty good, except for the fact that the rice tasted a bit bland, and the pad-see-ew was a bit salty. However, combining both together hit the spot!
author: Andy P.

description: This is my new thai restaurant for now.  I always get the garlic pepper prawns, very, very good!  I also tried one chicken dish which also tasted good, the quality of the chicken was good, no suprises!
author: Paul M.

description: Pat Pong is a great thai place. The restaurant is softly lit and enjoyable to sit in. A little drafty because of the glass windows so we generally ask for a table towards the back. Delivery service is GREAT - and well prepared.
author: Sarah A.

description: I really love this place. We have a baby, so we often get delivery. The food is always hot and delicious! The staff is always professional and  sweet. Love it! 5 stars for best Thai in the Richmond/Outer Richmond area. 4 stars because I am not sure what it compares to in other neighborhoods. :o) Oh their fresh rolls are much different than your usual, BUT they are sooooo good! The sauce is amazing!!!
author: Keely G.

description:
the worst service ever!!!!  they delivered the wrong order two times in one week and did nothing to make it right.  they promised free beverage instead of comping the 2nd half of the order we had to wait for them to bring back.  too bad they not only didn't come with beverage, they made us pay and tip again.  the people that take orders do not speak english and will f**k up your order.

horrible!!! business ethics.  i was a loyal patron, ate there at least once a week and they have now lost my business and all of my friends and family's business
author: J L.

description: Maybe this place does more delivery and take-out cause every time I walk by the restaurant is empty. (Probably should have taken that fact into more consideration.) On one occasion I ordered takeout and was not impressed. Considering their prices I figured I would have gotten a larger portion, I was wrong! Since they put a flyer on my door and its somewhat convenient on Clement I figured i would give it a try. Now that I have experienced it, I most likely will not be back.
author: Trev D.

description:
Patpong, you guys suck. 

I'm sick today, so I decide I want some warm, spicy soup to clear my head. I walk by. I notice your menu. Taking a look at it, a hot and sour soup sounds delicious!! The price, $4.95 for one person. Sounds decent!

I go in, service is quick, I order, I wait. The bill comes in less than one minute and whoa whoa, it's $10!!! I don't mean to argue, so I apologize before I start, but I say your menu outside did not list this price. He goes, "well it's dinner time". I go outside and look, the menu says "dinner menu". I stand there for awhile thinking, should I ditch the soup? Should I just pay for it? I go back in and I talk to another server who says, "the portion is bigger" and "you got take out so it costs more, the price outside is for dine-in".

REALLY?!?! Why don't you say all that on the menu outside instead of tricking people thinking it's one price, and then it's not. 

Sorry Patpong, I'm not paying $10 for a small soup.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Not bad. Ordered take out and had Poh rah seafood dish. Very tangy and very yummy especially with white rice. Cannot comment on other dishes, the seafood was ok, mixture of shrimps, scallop, fish, mussells. It could have afforded a bit more seafood for $12.95. Not too salty. I also ordered the mango and sticky rice for $4.95 and that was tasty! Not bad  for a neighborhood joint but not cheap as king of thai. bv
author: Petri Y.

description:
hmm still good and cheaper than other Thai places BUT the last 2 times I ordered here the portions that came looked WAY smaller AND the dishes were very spicy instead of mild AND I think they are using different shrimp roll wrappers
.... not quite a 3-star but getting there... watch it Patpong... I am not afraid to cheat on you...
author: Jessica L.

description: Another one of my hoodie spots.  The best home-cooking thai food for the price and all the servers and drivers are flat-out NICE.  Yeah, i said it.  Sure-shot culinary pleasure if you order the Pad Kee Mao, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Spicy Crispy Chicken.  Yatta!
author: omar b.

description: My friend suggested this place to me and I met him here to check it out. The first thing that was a huge pain was that there was NO parking anywhere, I drove around for 20 minutes, finally parking about 10 blocks away and walked over. The staff was friendly, there wasn't many people in there and the service was decent, however it could have been better, especially since there was only one other table besides ours. The food was pretty good Thai food, not the best I had ever had but nothing stuck out in my mind as being terrible. I will probably go back to check out more of the dishes and see how the service is on another night.
author: Bobby B.

description:
one of my favorite thai restaurants. i LOVE their chicken wings! i always order them everytime i come here. 

i ordered take-out today since i had a menu in my car. [ i like to keep take-out menus in my car just in case i'm around the area.] anyway, i ordered 3 items: chicken wings, pad thai, and this fried chicken  with garlic rice entree. the total came up to almost $25. i was wondering why it cost so much. once i picked up my food, i took another take-out menu and compared it to the one i had in  my car. i noticed all the prices went up! the chicken wings that were once  $5.95 (for 10 pieces) are now $6.95!! BoOoOo!  o-well......what can you do...

i still like this place tho. their food is very flavoful.
author: B B.

description: Good option for Thai delivery...  My one complaint is that nearly every dish has bell peppers, and I frickin' hate those things!  Why do bell peppers have to go and ruin perfectly good food?  Also, the green papaya salad is a little too lemon/limey -- almost like a fake flavoring, but otherwise everything else is good...
author: robyn s.

description: Came here on a Saturday around ~3. Our waitress was nice and we had the place to ourselves. I ordered a lunch special of red curry and my friend ordered some soup. Both lacked flavor, with so many Thai restaurants around I would pick a different place.
author: Jacquie S.

description:
The prices are cheap. The portions are not enormous but they're enough. I don't understand people stating "for the price I didn't get enough food." On top of that, the vast majority of what I use to get here (moved to other side of city) was really good. To be honest I've not had better pad se ew in san francisco. I'm to the point where I don't get thai food (in nob/russian hill) because I'm always disappointed and it always pales in comparrison to pat pong. 

also, the vast majority of times i ordered delivery the food would get there in under 20 minutes. i've never actually eaten at the restaurant
author: erik l.

description: I love this restaurant!  Usually I get take-out and they give me tea while I wait, which is never a long wait.  Last night I ate there for dinner.  Started with the garlic calamari on special--it was amazing.  The pieces of calamari were big and the seasoning was done just right.  Then, had yellow curry w/ beef for entree, also very good.  The portion was a little small, but the prices are pretty good, so I can't complain much.  The server was very nice, a little slow to collect the bill, though.  I will definitely go back and bring more friends.  It's never busy, which is good for me, but I hope they're doing okay, b/c I'd hate to see them go.  So, go eat there & keep them in business!!
author: Caressa M.

description: We went here for our 1 year anniversary from our wedding day. The food was good, we had the Beef Salad. Nice and flavorful the only problem is the dish had two plates the regular porcelain and the lazy susan lettuce action that spun our beef around making it hard to pick the food up. I felt like imitating Chris Rock "They spinnnin' ni--a they spinnin" advice chop the lettuce please. Then we had the fried calamari, lets just say i had to chew it up for a long time to keep it from scraping my passage. it was good though just left in the fryer a little too long. The Basil Spicy beef fried rice was good and moist and combo'd well with the Chicken Panang Curry. The food was good it just took a little while to get it. One take out customer came back with her order complaining about it when we first got there, then i ordered a diet coke and could hear the waitress scoop ice into the goblet and all of a sudden clang and crack. I thought to myself and said damn that's not a good start and do i really want to eat here now? In reality, It's not bad and the price is good. The place is sentimental to me so i'm sure we'll be back
author: graham c.

description:
I love this restaurant! Patpong offers yummy Thai food at a great price in a  quiet, mellow atmosphere. My boyfriend and I are in love with the Pad See-Ew and the Thai toast appetizer. Portions are also pretty big, too (good for the boyfriend). 

Patpong is our fall-back restaurant whenever we want a good, cheap meal that hasn't failed us yet! Our stomachs have always left happy and very full.
author: Clare K.

description: First of all, I've been to the real Patpong in Bangkok.  Thankfully this place is nothing like that.  Food was good, dining area was nice, chairs were a little uncomfortable, service was really nice.  Three of us did our orders family-style and everything i tried was good.  The fried taro appetizer was amazing.  definitely will come back.
author: Nessie V.

description: Best Thai Food I have ever tasted. 2 years in a row - they have given us "awesome" service in delivery, food preparation and timeliness. Thanks Patpong staff. You ARE THE "BEST" IN SAN FRANCISCO, CA.
author: Debbie M.

description: Very good food, very reasonably priced, nice decor and new inside
author: P B.

description:
What would otherwise be a 3-star restaurant gets a whole extra star just because of the Thai toast appetizer.  Sooooo good.

Other than that, the food is decent, good portions, fair price, done quickly, etc.  I almost always get it as takeout rather than eat there, so I can't say too much about the service, but the few times I've eaten there I had no complaints.  Basically your average Thai place, I'd say.

But the Thai toast!
author: Morgan M.

description: Yummy!!! My favorite Thai food in all of San Francisco!! It may be a tad expensive but to me, it's worth the price... It's also a little hole in the wall out in the Richmond, so don't go during busy hours... But I highly highly recommend them... Their food is soooo good... And they have GREAT daily specials!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
my favorite thai restaurant in the bay area.  granted i've only eaten here once, but i've found they have very unique dishes.  i had some fish dish that was a special and it was very tasty.  my husband ordered the pad see eu, it was the best i've ever eaten.  the service was also very excellent, and the restaurant is nicely decorated.  parking is a little difficult to find, but definitely worth it.

UPDATE:
since we liked this place so much the first time, we revisited it on 3/2.  man, what a disappointment.  Did they change the chef?  We ordered the Pad See Eu again, and it wasn't the same.  The service this time was spotty, they seemed to have forgotten what we ordered (though they were nice about bringing us the right stuff).  We also got the garlic prawns and ginger chicken.  Both were OK, but nothing outstanding.  Man, I swear we were in a different restaurant last time.
author: Waynele Y.

description: I always enjoy eating here.  Everything seems freshly prepared and very tasty.  Plus, the portions seem a bit larger than most so points for value-for-money here.  I'm not a big fan of the cruel-chairs, though.  Now I just do take-out.
author: Ken B.

description: I like their appetizers more than anything else-thai toast is the best, i think.  other than that, everything about this place is OK-food, prices, portion sizes, staff... just OK.  the flavor doesn't pop as much as thai food should.  this is the kinda place i'd go to if someone else wanted it, but I wouldn't eat here on my own.  I do like that they deliver, and usually fairly quickly.
author: asia c.

description: They have Tofu Satay which is amazing.  Great delivery - even though I do feel slightly embarrassed that all the food is for me (need to meet their $15 delivery min. so I order dinner & lunch).
author: Anna L.

description:
pretty decent thai. food is good but portions are kinda small...I'm an "enough for leftovers" kinda gal. 
points dinged cause the horrible radio stations they blast and also this one time it smelled like really toxic cleaning products. cancer with your pad seew anyone?
author: Lauren T.

description:
4.5 stars

Ah, Patpong.  Rescuer of late afternoon hunger and bestower of fiery bowels.  These, both good things, because when I say I want it spicy, I really, really MEAN it.  The sadist in me loves the total numbness of tongue, or TNT, if I may.  Patpong does not pussyfoot on the spice.  They elephantfoot or whatever the equivalent is.  When I tell them how spicy I want it, they wink a little, like, "We're going to hurt you, you know this yes?" and off they go to the chef-lair to plot my demise with the most bad-ass, tattoed ruffians of the nightshade family. I honestly believe they cultivate a magical pepper there yet undiscovered by anyone else and they save it for MY food!  

Lunch is great, very inexpensive, good value, and quick.  The chairs look like they may have once had padding but it was torn off and then the frame was soaked to get all the possible butt-comforting nuggets of padd off.  What remains is what you find yourself sitting on when you dine in at Patpong, which is why I'd recommend delivery-

Gotta say, it's always packaged well, comes with my requested extra peanut sauce, and offers great little gems of tastiness for next-day fridge diggins.  

Who are all these folks on here leaving hungry?  I often feel explosively full after a good frolic with Patpong's danger team, that being Tofu Satay and Pad Kee Mao.  I occasionally add the Hot and Sour Soup when I'm not being rational with myself, which always results in ye olde, "It's time for pants with a stretchy waistband" feeling.  I have shared this same meal (well, not the Mao cause my BF can't take it) with my partner in crime, and there were STILL leftovers!   The Pad Thai or noodle dishes are not good reheated, but they historically never have been and noodles are best when they're freshly cooked anyways.  No fault of Patpong's of course; when I solve this world mystery about noodle-to-Fridgidaire hardening ratios, I will build a museum around my house and charge admission.  Til' then, it's the dish you should just try to finish so you don't have to get all verklempt about throwing it away.

You could always give it to a Freegan.
author: Lea N.

description: Food is good, but a bit pricey. would be great if you have friends live in the neighbourhood who will get coupons in the mail.
author: cynthia l.

description: Patpong, you dun me wrong. My friend's favorite thai place was closed, but things were looking up when you came along offering free delivery on a chilly night. I ordered my standards: tom ka gai and panang curry with chicken and tofu plus thai iced tea and pad thai.  The iced tea was absolutely perfect, the soup was acceptable until I realized how much of the container was filled with the inedible galang stalks and kaffir leaves. The chicken was way tough. But where you truly dropped the ball was with the curry- because you didn't send along any rice. The chicken here was much better but the dish overall was mediocre with green pepper. Pad thai was totally greasy and uninspired. Pass.
author: Greycella L.

description:
Great to have choices, especially when there is three good Thai restaurants all within a few blocks of each other. Patpong stands out!

Friendly staff especially the young woman who works there week nights, politely took my order over the phone and even confirmed it with me before hanging up. And even dealt with my crazy antics when I changed the order twice more within 5 minutes. Everything was bagged, tagged and ready to go when I went to pickup, even when I added additional items. 

Not anymore expensive than other places, got 5 dishes and rice for around $44 and even had leftovers for lunch. If you like Spicy Thai make sure to convey that over the phone or when ordering. The Brown and Green Curry were mildly spicy at best, but I am whimp. 

Papaya salad, brown curry and shrimp and cashew dish are the best. Although as a true American I am going with some fried dishes next time. Ordering rice for about 4 is the equivalent for 6, so cut down on the rice order, unless you like starch.
author: David B.

description:
wish i could give it 4 & 1/2 stars!! sooo yummy!! very fast delivery!

would reccommend the spicy chicken wings for appetizer
spicy basil fried rice with beef entree
sweet sticky rice w/ mango for dessert

sooooooooo yummy!!!

:::::::finally went to the actual restaurant::::::::

and i HAVE to report!! very clean!! cute & modest decor. very authentic thai! Music was thai top 40 & our bill was written in thai characters... 

garlic calamari was yummm-o & I couldnt resist ordering the spicy thai basil rice with beef & cashews.... AGAIN!!
author: c e.

description: It's good food, in fact i think it's received best of SF for Thai food this past year.  I wouldn't say it's the most amazing Thai i've ever eaten, but it's good.  Prices are average and service is quick.
author: Heather S.

description:
I was really impressed with the food. Tried their grilled eggplant salad which just had an amazing harmony of flavors and the eggplant was just grilled to perfection. One of the best Thai places I have eaten at, especially for the price.
The service is a bit questionable and the portions are rather small but the overall experience can be a pleasure depending on how you get treated. I left happy but can imagine your displeasure if they overcharged you or just seemed shady.
Definitely give it a shot. It's worth it and it's delicious and that's what really matters, right? and if you don't like the service, order in.
author: Ankur S.

description: Great  pad see eu!  The other dishes I've had here are all run of the mill.  I think the place is a bit over priced.  There are cheaper spots close by that are just as yummy!  Some pluses: delivery available; coupons in valupack.
author: Cara C.

description: Cute, small and in the calmer dining area of Clement. Portions here are smaller than elsewhere, but it is cheap. The Tom Yum is amazing and the ginger tofu is awesome too.  The dining area is small so I wouldn't suggest this for a party of more than 4.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This has got to be one of the best kept secrets. The food is excellent.

True, I live in the neighborhood and walk there.  You folks that come with your car, well...., good luck with the parking.
author: A S.

description: Personally, I absolutely love this place. I am very fortunate to live in the vicinity of many great restaurants but this Thai place is a wonderful gem. The food is absolutely delicious. I am not a huge fan of soup but not this restaurant's in particular, just not a huge soup fan but the noodle dishes here are to die for. I've had pad thai, both vegetarian and meat, and I've had other noodle dishes whose name I don't remember, but every single time I have noodles here, I literally will eat every drop and lick my fingers. And oh yeah, Thai Iced Tea? Freaking delish.
author: Eugenia S.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants and being in the Richmond district, there's no shortage!  Their Panang curry w/ Chicken and their version of Ground Chicken with the spicy basil is the best I've ever had.  One of my other must haves is  their chicken wings with the spicy glaze!  Their Tom Yum soup is good too and they make a good pad thai.   Great cucumber salad too.   I usually get delivery; service can be a bit slow when you dine in (hence four stars not five) but the food is worth it.  If you have a Thai craving, this is the place to go!
author: Sandria W.

description: We had a large group so we had a good variety of different dishes.  I felt all the dishes were very tasty and well flavored.  Definitely recommend the pad-se-ew, we ended up adding dishes of that to our order since everyone wanted more.  Dishes are a little on the small side, I think we had 12 dishes for 9 people.  Overall I think the food quality was very good and tasty.
author: Alex W.

description:
Service is very slow. Even on a Thursday night with maybe 3 tables used, I had to wait a long time for he food, water refills and the check, even after asking twice. Another patron complained to the waitresses that he'd been sitting there for a while but hadn't been given a menu since he got there. 
The food is decent. the stuffed chicken appetizer was tasty, even though my utensil-challenged brother complain about not being able to cut it. I also had the duck, which only came with maybe 6 small slices on a bed of veggies for $10. My brother had the crab meat pad thai which looked tasty, but I didn't get any. My mom had the "huge salad" which has a weird name but was rather large. I didn't care for the dressing on it, but I'm not really into dressing all that much. 
I think the wait kind of ruined the whole experience for me. The food is fine if you have it delivered, but if you eat there or pick it up, be prepared to wait a while.
author: AJ M.

description: I have been here twice and left very happy both times. The food was very cheap and the portions were just right. We had the fat noodles (can't remember the name but they are under the vegetarian section) and the panang curry. Both dishes were excellent. I just can't believe people say this place is expensive!!
author: Maria D.

description: There a ton of Thai restaurants in the Richmond, but we love this one.  Delivery is free if you spend $15 and it's usually pretty fast.  Lots of tofu dishes if you're into that and the chicken is decent quality - much better than a lot out there.  There might be cheaper options, but I think you get what you pay for.
author: Meghan S.

description:
The food was o.k. but the experience wasn't.  I went with some friends and we all had something different and all of the dishes were tasty but nothing stood out.  A nice lemon-grass dish was the best.  

But we had a coupon for a free desert and also a parking ticket that needed validation (they have a deal with a parking lot down the street).  They wouldn't do both things--it was either the desert or the parking.  It clearly said on the coupon and the parking ticket that there were no strings attached etc.  Anyway, we took the desert--a weird fried thing--and paid the parking.

What could have been an o.k. experience went south.  Why, if you're a Thai restaurant competing with many in the same area and hundreds in SF, would you go petty on customers like this?  You can bet that I'll never eat at Patpong again.
author: Murray S.

description:
Ehh... Foods fine, portions are small-er. 

I guess I have been spoiled. My lady friend is Thai herself and after spending a month in Thailand I have been accustomed to Spic-ier Thai food.

Oh well. Generally foreigners don't enjoy gargling Thai spices for 2 hours.. it's not that bad.

With this said. If any of you ever make it to Thailand... make sure to visit the Patpong district... you might enter this restaurant with different eyes..
author: Mic F.

description: Because we had a coupon, we decided to try this place out since I love Thai food.  We started off with the green onion pancakes which was  nice and flaky and very tasty.  It came with a dip consisting of chili oil with cucumber slices. We ordered Pad Kee Mao which was rice noodles with pork and red peppers.  We also had their spicy chicken fried rice with basil, red peppers, onions and green beans.  The chicken were in chunks and not your normal diced chicken.   Although the food was great, the portions were small.  I've gone to other Thai restaurants and their portions are twice the size of what we got.   We were the only two customers in the restaurant and I felt the service could've been better.   We had to flag the waitress down to fill up our water glasses.  Plus, on the website, it indicated that there was a Special Offer -- Receive a FREE dessert with your dinner order.  I asked about it and the waitress said they no longer offer the free deseert.  I told her it should  be removed from the website as it is deceiving.
author: Mary C.

description: i like their curry, pad thai and their stuffed chicken wings, service is alright, parking sucks and price a little high
author: Wan Y.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants, and i've been to about 15 in the city.  Very well priced, lovely atmosphere, and good to great food.
author: Kristi S.

description: Pretty good Thai food. One of the better places I've visited. Portions are a bit smaller than I'd like for the price, but the taste more than makes up for it. I would recommend.
author: Gordon L.

description: We only ate here because it's a couple blocks from our house and we had one of those ValuPac coupons you get in the mail. I love Thai food and am not very picky about it, but the food here was...I wouldn't say horrifying, but really sub-par. Every dish we ordered (and these were standard Thai dishes, nothing fancy) was overcooked and not tasty at all. I would never eat here again. Bai Som a few blocks down is a lot better, though it's a shame Narai closed down because that used to be my favorite in this area.
author: Sasquatch M.

description: Being of the vegetarian persuasion, I can't comment on their meat items but the vegetarian stuff I've had has been excellent. I highly recommend the tofu/vegetable dish in ginger black bean sauce (I think it's #73 or #74 in the vegetarian section). It reminds me of the food I had in a chef-school restaurant in Bangkok.
author: Bobby Z.
